sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: April 27, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the Stockholders of Baker Hughes Incorporated:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of the Stockholders of Baker Hughes Incorporated (the Company, Baker Hughes, we, us or our) will be held in the Auditorium at 2001 Rankin Road, Houston, Texas on Thursday, April 27, 2017, at 9:00 a.m., CDT, for the purpose of considering and voting on:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The election of directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. An advisory vote related to the Company's executive compensation program;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. An advisory vote on the frequency of the holding of an advisory vote on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. The ratification of Deloitte & Touche LLP as the Company's independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. A stockholder proposal regarding a majority vote standard for all non-binding stockholder proposals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. Such other business as may properly come before the meeting and any reconvened meeting after an adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has fixed March 3, 2017 as the record date for determining the stockholders of the Company entitled to notice of, and to vote at the meeting and any reconvened meeting after an adjournment thereof, and only holders of Common Stock of the Company of record at the close of business on that date will be entitled to notice of, and to vote at the meeting and any reconvened meeting after an adjournment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are invited to attend the meeting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend in person, we urge you to promptly vote your shares by telephone, by the Internet or, if this Proxy Statement was mailed to you, by completing, signing, dating and returning it as soon as possible in the enclosed postage prepaid envelope in order that your vote may be cast at the Annual Meeting of the Stockholders (the "Annual Meeting").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy any time prior to its exercise, and you may attend the meeting and vote in person, even if you have previously returned your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: M. Lee Whitley Vice President and Corporate Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Houston, Texas March 17, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO ASSURE YOUR REPRESENTATION AT THE MEETING, PLEASE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) VOTE YOUR SHARES BY TELEPHONE OR THE INTERNET, OR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) IF YOU RECEIVED A PAPER COPY, THEN SIGN, DATE AND RETURN YOUR PROXY AS PROMPTLY AS POSSIBLE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement is furnished in connection with the solicitation of proxies by the Board of Directors of Baker Hughes Incorporated, a Delaware corporation, to be voted at the Annual Meeting scheduled to be held on Thursday, April 27, 2017 and at any and all reconvened meetings after adjournments thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information About the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC), we now furnish to our stockholders proxy materials, including our 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K of the Company (the Annual Report) to Stockholders, on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 17, 2017, we will send electronically an annual meeting package personalized with profile and voting information (Electronic Delivery) to those stockholders that have previously signed up to receive their proxy materials via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 17, 2017, we will begin mailing a Notice of Internet Availability of proxy materials (the E-Proxy Notice) to those stockholders that previously have not signed up to receive their proxy materials on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received the E-Proxy Notice by mail, you will not automatically receive a printed copy of the proxy materials or the Annual Report to Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received the E-Proxy Notice by mail and would like to receive a printed copy of our proxy materials or Annual Report to Stockholders, you should follow the instructions for requesting such materials included in the E-Proxy Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may sign up to receive future proxy materials and other stockholder communications electronically instead of by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to receive the communications electronically, you must have an e-mail account, access to the Internet through an Internet service provider and a web browser that supports secure connections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Visit www.proxyvote.com for additional information regarding electronic delivery enrollment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder of Record; Shares Registered in Your Name
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If on March 3, 2017 (the "record date"), your shares were registered directly in your name with our transfer agent, Computershare Shareowner Services LLC, you are considered a stockholder of record with respect to those shares, and we sent the proxy materials directly to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by proxy over the Internet at the following Internet address: www.proxyvote.com, or if you properly request and receive a proxy card by mail or email, over the phone by calling Broadridge Financial Solutions ("Broadridge") at 1-800-690-6903.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies submitted through Broadridge by the Internet or telephone must be received by 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern time (10:59 p.m. Central time) on April 26, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The giving of a proxy will not affect your right to vote in person if you decide to attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owner; Shares Registered in the Name of the Broker, Bank or Other Agent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If on March 3, 2017, your shares were held in "street name" in an account at a brokerage firm, bank or other nominee holder, then you are considered the beneficial owner of the shares and the proxy materials were forwarded to you by that organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The organization holding your account is considered the stockholder of record for purposes of voting at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct the organization on how to vote the shares held in your account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may direct the vote of these shares by the Internet or telephone by following the instructions on the voting form enclosed with the proxy materials from the bank or brokerage firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes directed by the Internet or telephone through such a program must be received by Broadridge by 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern time (10:59 p.m. Central time) on April 26, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directing the voting of your shares will not affect your right to vote in person if you decide to attend the meeting; however, you must first request a legal proxy from your broker either on the Internet or use the voting form that accompanies this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requesting a legal proxy prior to the deadlines described above will automatically cancel any voting directions you have previously given by the Internet or by telephone with respect to your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares for which proxies have been executed will be voted as specified in the proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If no specification is made, the shares will be voted FOR the election of nominees listed herein as directors, FOR the advisory vote related to the Company's executive compensation program, FOR the frequency of ONE YEAR of the holding of an advisory vote on executive compensation, FOR the ratification of Deloitte & Touche LLP as the Company's independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017 and AGAINST the stockholder proposal regarding a majority
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vote standard for all non-binding stockholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any additional matter should
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be presented properly at the Annual Meeting, it is intended that the enclosed proxy will be voted in accordance with the discretion of the persons named in the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies may be revoked at any time prior to the exercise thereof by filing with the Company's Corporate Secretary, at the Company's executive offices, a written revocation or a duly executed proxy bearing a later date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive offices of the Company are located at 17021 Aldine Westfield Road, Houston, Texas 77073.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a period of at least ten days prior to the Annual Meeting, a complete list of stockholders entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting will be available for inspection during ordinary business hours at the Company's executive offices by stockholders of record for proper purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solicitation of Proxies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will bear the cost of any solicitation of proxies, whether by Internet or mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to solicitation, certain of the directors, officers and regular employees of the Company may, without extra compensation, solicit proxies by telephone, facsimile and personal interview.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has retained D.F. King & Co., Inc. to assist in the solicitation of proxies from stockholders of the Company for an anticipated fee of $8,500, plus out-of-pocket expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders of record or beneficial owners of the Company's Common Stock (as defined below) may attend the meeting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record, you may be asked to present proof of identification, such as a driver's license.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial owners must also present evidence of share ownership, such as a recent brokerage account or bank statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All attendees must comply with our standing rules, which will be distributed upon entrance to the Annual Stockholder Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the Annual Stockholder Meeting, we recommend that you also vote by proxy as described in this Proxy Statement so that your vote will be counted if you later decide not to attend the Annual Stockholder Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will only deliver one Proxy Statement to multiple stockholders sharing an address unless we have received contrary instructions from one or more of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will promptly deliver a separate copy of this Proxy Statement to a stockholder at a shared address to which a single copy of the document was delivered upon oral or written request to: Baker Hughes Incorporated, Attn: Corporate Secretary, 17021 Aldine Westfield Road, Houston, Texas 77073, +1 (713) 439-8600.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may also address future requests for separate delivery of the Proxy Statement, or for delivery of a single copy where they are currently receiving multiple copies, by contacting us at the address or phone number listed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Terminated Merger Agreement with Halliburton
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On November 16, 2014, Baker Hughes, Halliburton Company ("Halliburton") and a wholly owned subsidiary of Halliburton, entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger (the "Halliburton Merger Agreement"), under which Halliburton would acquire all of the outstanding shares of Baker Hughes through a merger of Baker Hughes with and into a wholly owned subsidiary of Halliburton (the "Halliburton Merger").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the provisions of Section 9.1 of the Halliburton Merger Agreement, Baker Hughes and Halliburton agreed to terminate the Halliburton Merger Agreement on April 30, 2016, as a result of the failure of the Halliburton Merger to occur on or before April 30, 2016 due to the inability to obtain certain specified antitrust related approvals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Halliburton paid $3.5 billion to Baker Hughes on May 4, 2016, representing the termination fee required to be paid pursuant to the Halliburton Merger Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Electric Transaction Agreement and Plan of Merger
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On October 30, 2016, Baker Hughes, General Electric Company ("GE"), Bear Newco, Inc. ("Newco"), a Delaware corporation and a direct wholly owned subsidiary of Baker Hughes, and Bear MergerSub, Inc. ("Merger Sub"), a Delaware corporation and a direct wholly owned subsidiary of Newco, entered into a Transaction Agreement and Plan of Merger (the "Transaction Agreement"), pursuant to which, among other things,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Merger Sub will merge with and into Baker Hughes, with Baker Hughes as the surviving corporation (the "Surviving Entity") and a direct wholly owned subsidiary of Newco,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) each outstanding share of the Baker Hughes' common stock will be converted into the right to receive 1 share of Class A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: common stock, par value $0.0001 per share, of Newco ("Newco Class A Common Stock'),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) Newco will cause the Surviving Entity to be converted into a Delaware limited liability company ("Newco LLC") and Newco will become the sole managing member of Newco LLC,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) GE will (A) receive an approximately 62.5% membership interest in Newco LLC in exchange for contributing $7,400,000,000 (less the Class B Purchase Price, as defined below) in cash and GE's oil and gas business ("GE O&G") to Newco LLC, and (B) receive Class B common stock, par value $0.0001 per share, of Newco (the "Newco Class B Common Stock"), representing approximately 62.5% of the voting power of the outstanding shares of common stock of Newco, in exchange for contributing the par value thereof (the "Class B Purchase Price") to Newco and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) Newco will distribute as a special dividend an amount equal to $17.50 per share to the holders of record of the Newco Class A Common Stock (the "Transactions").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Immediately following the closing of the Transactions (the "Closing"),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) (A) GE will hold 100% of the Newco Class B Common Stock, which will represent approximately 62.5% of the voting power of the outstanding shares of common stock of Newco, and (B) Baker Hughes' stockholders immediately prior to the Closing will hold 100% of the Newco Class A Common Stock, which will represent approximately 37.5% of the voting power of the outstanding shares of common stock of Newco,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) (A) GE will hold an approximately 62.5% membership interest in Newco LLC and (B) Newco will hold an approximately 37.5% membership interest in Newco LLC and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the membership interests in Newco LLC, together with the Newco Class B Common Stock, will be exchangeable on a 1:1 basis for Newco Class A Common Stock, subject to certain adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rights (including voting rights) of Newco Class A Common Stock and Newco Class B Common Stock are identical; provided that Newco Class B Common Stock has no economic rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective from and following the Closing, Newco and its subsidiaries will operate under the name "Baker Hughes, a GE Company."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Transactions will be voted on at a special separate stockholder meeting to be held at a future date which has not been determined at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the Annual Stockholder Meeting to be Held on April 27, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement and the Annual Report and the means to vote by Internet are available on the Internet at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTING SECURITIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The securities of the Company entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting consist of shares of its Common Stock, par value $1.00 per share (Common Stock), of which 425,349,196 shares were issued and outstanding at the close of business on March 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders that hold shares at the close of business on the record date will be entitled to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of Common Stock entitles the holder thereof to one vote on each matter to be considered at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence in person or by proxy of the holders of a majority of our Common Stock issued and outstanding and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting will constitute a quorum to transact business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assuming a quorum is present at the Annual Meeting, the following voting standards apply:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal   Vote Required   Broker Non-Votes   Abstentions            Election of Directors   The affirmative vote of the majority  of  votes  cast  with respect to the election of each director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There  will  be  no cumulative voting in the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No effect on the outcome of the vote   Abstentions have no effect on the outcome of the vote The approval of the advisory vote related  to  the  Company's executive compensation program   The affirmative vote of the majority of shares present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No effect on the outcome of the vote   Abstentions  have  the  same effect as a vote against The approval of the advisory vote on the frequency of the holding of an advisory vote on executive compensation   The option of one year, two years  or  three  years  that receives the most votes will be deemed to have received the advisory  approval  of  our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No effect on the outcome of the vote   Abstentions have no effect on the outcome of the vote The approval of the ratification of Deloitte & Touche LLP as the Company's  independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017   The affirmative vote of the majority of shares present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers  may  vote  on uninstructed shares   Abstentions  have  the  same effect as a vote against The approval of the stockholder proposal regarding a majority vote standard  for  all  non-binding stockholder proposals   The affirmative vote of the majority of shares present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No effect on the outcome of the vote   Abstentions  have  the  same effect as a vote against
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers, banks or other nominees that hold shares of Common Stock in street name for a beneficial owner of those shares typically have the authority to vote in their discretion if permitted by the stock exchange or other organization of which they are members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers, banks and other nominees are permitted to vote the beneficial owner's proxy in their own discretion as to certain routine proposals under the rules of the New York Stock Exchange (the "NYSE Rules") when they have not received instructions from the beneficial owners, such as the ratification of the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a broker, bank or other nominee votes such uninstructed shares for or against a routine proposal, those shares will be counted towards determining whether or not a quorum is present and are considered entitled to vote on the routine proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, where a proposal is not routine, a broker, bank or other nominee is not permitted to exercise its voting discretion on that proposal without specific instructions from the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These non-voted shares are referred to as broker non- votes when the nominee has voted on other non-routine matters with authorization or voted on routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These shares will be counted towards determining whether or not a quorum is present, but will not be considered entitled to vote on the non-routine proposals such as Proposal 1 (the election of directors), Proposal 2 (the advisory vote related to the Company's executive compensation program), Proposal 3 (the advisory vote on the frequency of the holding of any advisory vote on executive compensation) and Proposal 5 (the stockholder proposal regarding a majority vote standard for all non-binding stockholder proposals).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 1 ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In analyzing director nominations, the Governance and Health, Safety & Environmental Committee ("Governance and HS&E Committee") strives to recommend candidates for director positions who will create a collective membership on the Board with varied experience and perspective and who maintain a Board that reflects diversity, including but not limited to gender, ethnicity, background, country of citizenship and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee strives to recommend candidates who demonstrate leadership and significant experience in a specific area of endeavor, comprehend the role of a public company director, exemplify relevant expertise, experience and a substantive understanding of domestic and international considerations and geopolitics, especially those pertaining to the service sector of the oil and gas and energy-related industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When analyzing whether directors and nominees have the experience, qualifications, attributes and skills, taken as a whole, to enable the Board of Directors to satisfy its oversight responsibilities effectively in light of the Company's business and structure, the Governance and HS&E Committee and the Board of Directors focus on the information summarized in each of the Directors' individual biographies set forth in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Board considered the ollowing:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Craighead's 30 years of experience working for Baker Hughes in various officer and leadership positions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Brenneman's leadership and financial experience in public companies including his service as a director of other public companies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cazalot's role as a former chairman of the board, chief executive officer and president of a publicly traded energy company as well as his many years of experience in the global energy business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Easter's position as former chairman, president and chief executive officer of an energy company, his years of leadership experience at a global oil and gas company and his experience serving on other public company boards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Elsenhans' positions as a former chairman and chief executive officer of a publicly traded energy company as well as her many years of leadership experience at a global oil and gas company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Fernandes' leadership roles in several public companies in the energy and manufacturing sectors, including his service as a director of other public companies and his extensive financial expertise;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gargalli's leadership and consulting experience, extensive public board service and her financial expertise;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Jungels' technical knowledge, executive roles, experience in the international energy industry and service as a member of public company boards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lash's engineering skills and knowledge of high technology, as well as his private equity leadership, manufacturing background, public service and financial expertise;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nichols' position as the former chairman and chief executive officer of a publicly-traded energy company, a successful career building a major oil and gas company and his leadership in related trade associations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stewart's role as the former chairman of the board, president and chief executive officer of a formerly publicly traded energy company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Watson's executive leadership roles and active involvement in a number of energy-related companies and service as a director of other public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors who are elected at the Annual Meeting will serve for a one-year term expiring at the Annual Meeting expected o be held in April 2018 or until his or her successor is elected and qualified or until his or her earlier death, retirement, resignation or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy holders will vote FOR the twelve persons listed below under Company Nominees for Director, unless contrary instructions are given.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign your proxy card but do not give instructions with respect to the voting of directors, your shares will be voted FOR the twelve persons recommended by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to give specific instructions with respect to the voting of directors, you must do so with respect to the individual nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election and Resignation Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the policy of the Board of Directors that any nominee for director who fails to receive a majority of the votes cast for his or her election shall be required to submit a letter of resignation to the Board's Governance and HS&E Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee will recommend to the Board of Directors whether or not the resignation should be accepted or whether such other action should be taken.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors shall act on the resignation, taking into account the Governance and HS&E Committee's recommendation, and publicly disclose (by a press release and filing an appropriate disclosure with the SEC) its decision regarding the resignation and, if such resignation is rejected, the rationale behind the decision within ninety days following certification of the election results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The resignation, if accepted by the Board, will be effective at the time of the Board of Directors' determination to accept the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board of Directors determines to accept the resignation of an unsuccessful incumbent, then the Board of Directors may fill the resulting vacancy pursuant to the Company's Bylaws or may decrease the size of the Board of Directors pursuant to the provisions of the Restated Certificate of Incorporation, as amended on April 22, 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal year 2016, each non-management director received equity in a grant date value amount of $175,000 in the form of restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted stock units vest 100% upon the earlier of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) one year from the date of grant, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the date of the annual meeting of stockholders next following the date of the director's 72nd birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2017, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors approved a new form of director restricted stock unit award agreement for future grants that amended the vesting date to the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) one year from the date of grant, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the date of the annual meeting of stockholders next following the date of the director's 75th birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Compensation Deferral Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director may defer his or her retainer fees on an annual basis under the Baker Hughes Incorporated Director Compensation Deferral Plan (the "Deferral Plan"), a non-qualified defined contribution plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deferral Plan provides for two deferral vehicles - the election of a stock option related deferral or a cash-based deferral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the director elects stock options, the aggregate deferred compensation as of the last day of the calendar quarter which would have
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: otherwise been paid shall be increased by a multiplier of 4.4 and then divided by the fair market value of the Company's Common Stock on the last day of such quarter to determine the number of options to be granted in exchange for the deferred compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For cash-based deferrals, the director's deferred compensation shall be credited to an account and the director may elect to receive interest based on the prime rate equivalent or the S&P 500 Index for the quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions under the Deferral Plan are made to the director in a lump sum payment based on a date designated by the director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the directors elected to have their compensation deferred for fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Fernandes and Watson accrue interest on a quarterly basis on previously deferred compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, Mr. Brady's beneficiary received a lump sum payment of $550,395 for previously accrued deferred compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Retirement Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company previously provided benefits under a Director Retirement Policy (the "Retirement Policy"), which remains in effect until all benefits accrued thereunder are paid in accordance with the current terms and conditions of the Retirement Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No additional benefits have been accrued under the Retirement Policy since December 31, 2001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Fernandes, Nichols and Watson and Ms. Gargalli have accrued benefits under the Retirement Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Stock Ownership Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-management director is expected to own at least five times his or her annual retainer in Company Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such ownership level should be obtained within five years from the date elected or appointed to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee reviews director stock ownership on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All non-management directors have met this ownership requirement.

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's Board of Directors believes the purpose of corporate governance is to maximize stockholder value in a manner consistent with legal requirements and the highest standards of integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted and adheres to corporate governance practices, which the Board and management believe promote this purpose, are sound and represent best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board periodically reviews these governance practices, Delaware law (the state in which the Company is incorporated), the rules and listing standards of the New York Stock Exchange ("NYSE") and SEC regulations, as well as best practices suggested by recognized governance authorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established the Company's Corporate Governance Guidelines as the principles of conduct of the Company's business affairs to benefit its stockholders, which conform to the NYSE corporate governance listing standards and SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines are attached as Annex A to this Proxy Statement, posted under the Corporate Governance section of the Company's website at www.bakerhughes.com and are also available upon request to the Company's Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Board of Directors, other than Mr. Craighead, the Company's Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, satisfy the independence requirements of the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a Policy for Director Independence, Audit/Ethics Committee Members and Audit Committee Financial Expert (Policy for Director Independence) included as Exhibit C to the Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such Policy supplements the NYSE independence requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who meet these independence standards are considered to be independent as defined therein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all the nominees for election at this Annual Meeting, other than Mr. Craighead, meet these standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, the Board of Directors held seventeen meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director attended more than 75% of the total number of meetings of the Company's Board of Directors and of the respective Committees on which he or she served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the Company's policy to request and encourage all of the Company's directors and nominees for election as directors to attend the Annual Meeting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Company's directors attended the Company's
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit/Ethics Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee held eight meetings during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each of the Audit/Ethics Committee members meet the NYSE standards for independence as well as those contained in the Company's Policy for Director Independence within the Corporate Governance Guidelines and that each member of the Audit/Ethics Committee meets the qualifications to be an audit committee financial expert under the SEC rules issued pursuant to the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 ("SOX").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has designated James A. Lash as the member of the Audit/Ethics Committee who serves as the audit committee financial expert.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee provides assistance to the Board of Directors in overseeing matters relating to the accounting and reporting practices of the Company, the adequacy of the Company's disclosure controls and internal controls, the quality and integrity of the quarterly and annual financial statements of the Company, the performance of the Company's internal audit function, and the review and pre-approval of the current year audit and non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit/Ethics Committee oversees the Company's compliance programs relating to legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee has developed Procedures for the Receipt, Retention and Treatment of Complaints to address complaints received by the Company regarding accounting, internal controls or auditing matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such procedures are included as Exhibit F to the Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee also is responsible for the selection and hiring of the Company's independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To promote independence of the audit, the Audit/Ethics Committee consults separately and jointly with the Company's independent registered public accounting firm, the internal auditors and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the NYSE requirements, our Audit/Ethics Committee is responsible for overseeing risk analysis and risk management procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee reviews guidelines and policies on enterprise risk management, including risk assessment and risk management related to the Company's major financial risk exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control such exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At every regularly scheduled meeting of the Audit/Ethics Committee, the Company's Chief Compliance Officer provides a report to the Committee regarding the Code of Conduct, including updates pertaining to the status of the Company's compliance with its standards, policies, procedures and processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains an Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) process under which it reviews its business risk framework, including an assessment of external and internal risks and appropriate mitigation activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's annual ERM report is provided to the Audit/Ethics Committee and a comprehensive in-person presentation is made to the entire Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the risk oversight exercised by the Audit/Ethics Committee of the Board of Directors, each of the Compensation Committee, the Finance Committee and the Governance and HS&E Committee regularly exercises oversight related to risks associated with responsibilities of the respective Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the risk management processes in place for the Company are appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee held eight meetings during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each of the Compensation Committee members meets the NYSE standards for independence as well as those contained n the Company's Policy for Director Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees our compensation programs and is charged with the review and approval of the Company's general compensation strategies and objectives and the annual compensation decisions relating to our executives and to the broad base of Company employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Their responsibilities also include reviewing management succession plans; making recommendations to the Board regarding executive employment agreements, severance agreements, change in control agreements and any special supplemental benefits applicable to executives; assuring that the Company's incentive compensation program, including the annual and long-term incentive plans, is administered in a manner consistent with the Company's compensation strategy; approving and/or recommending to the Board new incentive compensation plans and equity-based compensation plans; reviewing the Company's employee benefit programs; recommending for approval all administrative changes to compensation plans that may be subject to the approval of the stockholders or the Board; reviewing and reporting to the Board of Directors the levels of stock ownership by the senior executives in accordance with the Stock Ownership Policy; and reviewing any potential conflicts of interest of the compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is also responsible for reviewing the outcome of the stockholder advisory vote on senior executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may delegate its authority to subcommittees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for determining if there are any inherent potential risks in the compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee exercises oversight with respect to risks relating to the compensation of the senior executives as well as the employees of the Company generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee seeks to structure compensation packages and performance goals for compensation in a manner that does not incentivize employees to take risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee designs long-term incentive compensation, including restricted stock, performance units and stock options in such a manner that employees will forfeit their awards if their employment is terminated for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also retains the discretionary authority to reduce bonuses to reflect factors regarding individual performance that are not otherwise taken into account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's stock ownership guidelines established by the Board of Directors also serve to mitigate compensation-related risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, the Compensation Committee determined the Company's compensation policies and practices for employees were not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information pertaining to the Company's compensation policies and practices, please read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance and HS&E Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee held three meetings during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that the Governance and HS&E Committee members meet the NYSE standards for independence as well as those contained in the Company's Policy for Director Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The functions performed by the Governance and HS&E Committee include overseeing the Company's corporate governance affairs, health, safety and environmental compliance functions, government relations and monitoring compliance with the Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Governance and HS&E Committee proposes candidates for the Board of Directors, reviews the structure and composition of the Board, considers the qualifications required for continuing Board service and recommends directors' compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee annually reviews the Company's Policy Statement on Shareholders' Rights Plans and reports any recommendations to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Code of Conduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a Business Code of Conduct (the Code of Conduct) that applies to all officers, directors and employees, which includes the code of ethics for the Company's Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Accounting Officer and all other persons performing similar functions within the meaning of the securities laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct prohibits individuals from engaging in, or giving the appearance of engaging in any
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: activity involving a conflict, or reasonably foreseeable conflict, between personal interests and those of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Every year, each of these Company officers certifies compliance with the Company's Code of Conduct and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the applicable NYSE and SOX provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee oversees the administration of the Code of Conduct and responsibility for the corporate compliance effort with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's Code of Conduct and Code of Ethical Conduct Certification are posted under the Corporate Governance section of the Company's website at www.bakerhughes.com and are also available upon request to the Company's Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board's Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines require the election, by the independent directors, of a Lead Director who
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) presides at all meetings of the Board of Directors at which the Chairman is not present, including executive sessions of non-management directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) serves as a liaison between the Chairman and the non-management directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) has the authority to call meetings of the non-management directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) works with the Chairman in developing Board meeting agendas, schedules, and information provided to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) communicates with significant stockholders when appropriate on matters involving broad corporate policies and practices; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) ensures effective functioning of Board committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E reviews and recommends to the Board a director to serve as Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: J. Larry Nichols is the current Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors hold executive sessions at every regularly scheduled Board and Committee meeting and at such other times as the Board deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board leadership structure is utilized by numerous public companies in the United States, and we believe that it provides the optimal balance and is an effective leadership structure for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that the current structure, with a combined CEO and Chairman of the Board and an independent Lead Director, is in the best interests of the Company and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combined role of CEO and Chairman provides an effective balance between management of the Company and director participation in our board process and allows for management to focus on the execution of our strategic and business plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As indicated above, our independent Lead Director was elected by the independent Board members and has a clear set of comprehensive duties that counterbalance the governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At a meeting of the Board of Directors on October 26, 2016, the Board of Directors increased the director retirement age from 72 to 75.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors determined that it was in the best interests of the Company to maintain experienced and knowledgeable directors of the Company during the pending Transaction with General Electric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Membership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee has implemented policies regarding Board membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee will consider candidates based upon the size and existing composition of the Board, the number and qualifications of candidates, the benefit of continuity on the Board and the relevance of the candidate's background and experience with issues facing the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee also strives to maintain a Board that reflects diversity, including but not limited to, gender, ethnicity, background, country of citizenship and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The criteria used for selecting directors are described in the Company's Guidelines for Membership on the Board of Directors, included as Exhibit A to the Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company has established a formal process for the selection of candidates, as described in the Company's Selection Process for New Board of Directors Candidates included as Exhibit B to the Corporate Governance Guidelines, and candidates are evaluated based on their background, experience and other relevant factors as described in the "Guidelines for Membership on the Board of Directors."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Governance and HS&E Committee will evaluate candidates properly proposed by stockholders in the same manner as all other candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Nominations of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee has established, in accordance with the provisions of the Company's Bylaws regarding stockholder nominees, a policy that it will consider director candidates proposed by stockholders in the same manner as all other candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations that stockholders desire to make for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders should be submitted between October 10, 2017 and November 9, 2017 in accordance with the Company's Bylaws and Policy and Submission Procedures for Stockholder Recommended Director Candidates included as Exhibit D to the Corporate Governance Guidelines and are also available upon request to: Chair, Governance and HS&E Committee of the Board of Directors, P.O. Box 4740, Houston, Texas, 77210, or to the Corporate Secretary, c/o Baker Hughes Incorporated, 17021 Aldine Westfield Road, Houston, Texas, 77073.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such recommendations should be
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accompanied by the information required under the Company's Bylaws for stockholder nominees and in accordance with the Company's "Policy and Submission Procedures for Stockholder Recommended Director Candidates."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Communications with the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To provide the Company's stockholders and other interested parties with a direct and open line of communication to the Company's Board of Directors, stockholders may communicate with any member of the Board, including the Company's Lead Director, the Chair of any committee or with the non-management directors of the Company as a group, by sending such written communication to the Company's Corporate Secretary, c/o Baker Hughes Incorporated, 17021 Aldine Westfield Road, Houston, Texas, 77073.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The procedures for Stockholder Communications with the Board of Directors are also included as Exhibit E to the Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, pursuant to the Company's policy to request and encourage attendance at the Annual Meeting, such meeting provides an opportunity for stockholders to communicate with members of the Company's Board of Directors in attendance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has, and strictly follows, formalized policies and procedures for identifying potential related party transactions and ensuring those policies are reviewed by the Board of Directors and the Audit/Ethics Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We subject the following related persons to these procedures: directors, director nominees, executive officers, individual 5% stockholders and any immediate family members of these persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As outlined in Exhibit C to our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Board annually re-evaluates the independence of any related person for any transactions, arrangements or relationships, or any series of similar transactions, arrangements or relationships in which any director, director nominee, executive officer, or any immediate family member of those persons could be a participant, the amount involved exceeds $120,000, and in which any related person had or will have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have a formal set of standards to be substantively applied to each transaction reviewed by the Audit/Ethics Committee and then the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the standards utilized in its annual Director & Officer Questionnaire to determine if a related party transaction exists are modeled after Section 303A.02 of the New York Stock Exchange's Listed Company Manual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead of a formalized standard, potential related party transactions are reviewed and judgment is applied by the Board of Directors in accordance with its duties under Delaware and other applicable law to determine whether such transactions are in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the discussion under the Business Code of Conduct in this Proxy Statement, the Baker Hughes Incorporated Policy for Director Independence, Audit/Ethics Committee Members and Audit Committee Financial Expert are included as Exhibit C of the Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company utilizes standard accounting procedures and responses to the director and officer questionnaires to monitor its financial records and determine whether a related person is involved in a business relationship or transaction with the Company for which disclosure is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 1, 2014, the Company entered into a Transloading and Storage Services Agreement with Twin Eagle Sand Logistics (formerly, Frac Resources, LLC) which provided for the transloading and storing of proppant sands (the "Storage Agreement").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A member of the Company's Board of Directors, Mr. Watson, indirectly owns more than 10% of Twin Eagle Sand Logistics ("TESL") and is co-founder and chairman of the board of a parent entity of which TESL is a majority-owned indirect subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Storage Agreement was for an initial two-year term, and had an estimated value of $2,520,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company paid $916,093 to TESL during fiscal year 2014 and $2,386,018 during fiscal year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Company paid a final amount of $979,200 under the Storage Agreement in order to comply with the minimum annual throughput volume commitment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Storage Agreement was terminated on March 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company entered into a new Transloading and Storage Services Agreement with TESL effective March 16, 2016 (the "2016 Storage Agreement").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Storage Agreement was a month-to-month agreement for the transloading and storage of proppant sands and had an indeterminable value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company did not make any payments to TESL in 2016 under the 2016 Storage Agreement and sent notice to terminate the 2016 Storage Agreement to TESL on February 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policies and procedures described above were followed in connection with the transactions contemplated by the Storage Agreement and the 2016 Storage Agreement.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of our compensation program is to motivate exceptional individual and organizational performance that is in the long-term best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use traditional compensation elements of base salary, annual short- term incentives, long-term incentives, and employee benefits to deliver attractive and competitive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We benchmark both compensation and Company performance in evaluating the appropriateness of pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive pay decisions are made by an independently Compensation Committee of our Board of Directors, with assistance from its independent consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We target the market median for base salary and short-term incentive compensation, while providing the opportunity for executives to earn upper quartile incentive pay based on Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Business Context and Performance Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a transformative year for Baker Hughes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Halliburton Merger Agreement that was entered into in November 2014 was terminated on April 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the uncertainty of those 18 months behind us, and no longer being restricted by certain operating covenants in the Halliburton Merger Agreement, in May 2016 we announced plans to enhance our core strength as a product innovator, reduce costs by simplifying our business, and optimize our capital structure to deliver more value to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Baker Hughes was focused on turning the page and moving forward with speed to chart a course for a successful future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, against the back-drop of what is arguably the worst downturn in our industrys history, we achieved significant progress on our commitments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the second half of 2016, we rapidly and successfully reorganized our Company, reduced annualized costs by nearly $700 million, refined our go-to-market strategy with plans to build new sales channels for our products and technology, bolstered our investment in our sales organization, and launched 50% more new products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we optimized our capital structure by reducing debt and buying back shares with proceeds from the $3.5 billion merger breakup fee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we executed on an asset-light strategy to strengthen profitability and return on invested capital, we rationalized under-performing product lines in select markets and contributed our North America land pressure pumping business into a new venture that is exceptionally well positioned to participate efficiently and cost- effectively in the growth of this market segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In spite of ongoing market and industry challenges, we accomplished these results without losing our focus on safety, compliance, or operational performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the midst of this important work, on October 30, 2016, Baker Hughes and GE entered into an agreement to combine Baker Hughes with GE Oil & Gas and create Baker Hughes, a GE Company, which we anticipate will become a productivity leader in the industry by delivering substantial value to shareholders through greater productivity and more efficient operating economics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summarizing our financial results, full-year revenue was $9.8 billion, down $5.9 billion compared to $15.7 billion for 2015, reflecting challenging industry conditions that resulted in global rig counts declining another 32% from 2015 levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a GAAP basis, net loss attributable to Baker Hughes was $2.7 billion ($6.31 per diluted share) for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flows from operating activities were $4.2 billion for the year, an increase of $2.4 billion, compared to 2015, primarily due to the receipt of the $3.5 billion Halliburton Merger termination fee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the second half of 2016, we achieved significant progress on virtually all facets of our business as we implemented our new strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stronger performance in the second half of 2016 demonstrates that we not only executed on our new strategic financial and operational objectives we set following the termination of the Halliburton Merger Agreement, we exceeded them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The highlights are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Simplified our organizational structure and operational footprint and reduced our annualized costs by nearly $700 million, exceeding our initial goal by almost 40%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accelerated innovation with nearly 70 new product innovations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paid down $1 billion of debt and repurchased more than $750 million in shares of our Common Sto
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Built new sales channels and rationalized under-performing product lines in select markets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a GAAP basis, net loss attributable to the Company was $1,892 million for the first half of 2016 compared to a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: loss of $846 million in the second half of 2016;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted operating profit (a non-GAAP measure) for the second half of 2016 was $28 million compared to an adjusted operating loss of nearly $700 million for the first half of 2016; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved 208 Perfect Health Safety and Environment ("HSE") days (no recordable injuries, no vehicle accidents, and no harm to the environment) for all of 2016 in spite of extremely difficult business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Decisions Made in the Context of Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our people and their capabilities are critical to our success, and maintaining a strong talent base in spite of significant uncertainty is essential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The significant downturn in our industry led to the reduction of our headcount from approximately 60,000 employees at the end of 2014 to approximately 33,000 employees today as well as reductions in various elements of compensation for employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the uncertainty for employees during the eighteen-month pendency of the Halliburton Merger threatened our ability to retain key employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With this backdrop, the Compensation Committee made he following key compensation decisions for the first half of 2016 (January through June 30):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to constraints on implementing significant changes to the business pending completion of the Halliburton Merger, we structured the Annual Incentive Compensation Plan for Employees (AICPE) to reward performance in excess of financial targets, with a guarantee of a target level bonus for all bonus-eligible employees for the first six months of 2016 (approximately 20,000 employees, including Senior Executives) who remained with the Company through the payment date of March 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Had the Halliburton Merger been consummated during 2016, a pro- rated target level bonus would have been paid to all participants under our annual bonus plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Suspended the annual salary merit increase cycle globally (including Senior Executives) and limited promotions and off-cycle salary increases for the second consecutive year, consistent with practices of other companies in our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the termination of the Halliburton Merger Agreement, the Company outlined steps to strengthen our competitive position and financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to compensation, this included reinforcing the pay for performance philosophy that has long been a key part of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following highlights some of the compensation decisions made for the second half of 2016 (July - December 31) with a focus on strengthening our competitive position and financial performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reinstated a 100% performance-based bonus structure based upon key financial metrics and strategic performance metrics that reinforce a return to profitability for the second half of 2016;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approved 2017 long-term incentive program design returning to performance-based awards; and  Initiated a temporary salary reduction for many US employees, including most Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2017, after announcing the Transaction Agreement with GE on October 30, 2016, the Company continued to reinforce the pay for performance elements of its compensation programs by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuing a 100% performance-based short-term incentive bonus structure for 2017 based on key financial and strategic performance metrics; and
