sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are designed to deliver compensation that is aligned with Company performance and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, while modifications were made for the first half of 2016 in order to retain a strong talent base, the Company resumed our commitment to our long-standing pay for performance philosophy in the second half of 2016 as well as 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below illustrates the Company's three-year realized pay percentile ranking and three-year performance percentile ranking for our PEO and the Company's oilfield services peer group which includes Halliburton Company (HAL), National Oilwell Varco Inc. (NOV), Schlumberger Ltd. (SLB) and Weatherford International Ltd. (WFT) (the "Peer Group").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart reflects that for the three-year period, the Companys Total Shareholder Return ("TSR") performance was highest among its Peer Group and realized pay was aligned with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charts below further illustrate how the Company's three-year annualized TSR outperformed the TSR of all of the Peer Group over the three-year period ending 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the second chart illustrates that on a three-year basis, while our PEO's total cash compensation is below the median of our Peer Group, our stock price has outperformed peers, resulting in realized pay outcomes that are commensurate with our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The market median pay is based on the proxy filings for 2013 - 2015 for the four peers and excludes our PEO's data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To reward both short and long-term performance and to further our compensation objectives, our executive compensation program is designed to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objectives How We Meet Our Objectives Attract and retain knowledgeable, experienced, and high performing Senior Executives Provide a competitive total pay package, taking into account base salary, incentives and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regularly benchmark our pay programs against the competitive market, comparing both fixed and variable, at-risk compensation that is tied to short and long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use the results of this analysis as context in making pay adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administer plans to include three-year performance cycles on long-term incentive plan awards, three-year vesting schedules on equity incentives, and competitive total benefit programs, including retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, the long-term incentive plan has consisted of a combination of stock options, restricted stock awards, and cash-based and stock-based performance units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee did not grant new stock options or performance units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, equity awards included performance-based restricted stock units as well as service-based restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward the creation of long- term stockholder value The incentive programs include specific financial performance measures that are fundamental to long-term stockholder value creation: The AICPE uses earnings per share, inventory as a percentage of revenue, and days sales outstanding, and adjusted operating profit targets set by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term incentive plan performance-based restricted stock units use revenue
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: growth and return on capital employed performance metrics as compared to our peer group, as well as for certain grants prior to 2017, a relative TSR modifier compared to TSR's of the companies included in the OSX Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objectives How We Meet Our Objectives Address the complexities in managing a cyclical business that is subject to variable world supply and demand for oil and gas The short-term incentive programs provide for formulaic and non- formulaic short-term performance goals and rewards managers for the achievement of those goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term incentive plan utilizes a combination of share growth and full-value awards, balancing retention and appreciation through the business cycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, full-value awards were utilized for the long-term incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, performance based and service based restricted stock units were utilized for the long-term incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based restricted stock unit component of the long-term incentive plan measures Company performance relative to industry peers, mitigating the difficulty in goal setting over long periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drive and reward performance that supports the Company's core values of integrity, teamwork, performance, learning and courage Success in the promotion of core values is considered in the base salary review process and when determining annual award values for long-term incentive compensation awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive programs allow for the reduction or elimination of bonus payouts if the Company's core values or compliance standards are not upheld.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide a significant percentage of total compensation that is variable and at risk Annual and long-term incentive compensation comprises, on average, more than two- thirds of our Senior Executives' total direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reinforce adherence to high ethical, environmental, health and safety standards The performance scorecard bonus component may include specific business goal targets related to HSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive programs allow for reduction or elimination of bonus payouts if the HSE standards are not upheld.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Motivate management to take prudent, but not excessive, risks Pay programs emphasize long-term incentive compensation with overlapping year- over-year performance-based vesting schedules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our share ownership guidelines encourage Executives to focus on the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We typically utilize multiple performance measures for short-term and long-term incentives, as well as peer comparisons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's clawback policy allows for the potential recoupment of short-term and long-term incentive compensation in the event of a financial restatement resulting from gross negligence, intentional misconduct or fraud.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align executive and stockholder interests Our share ownership guidelines motivate alignment between long-term stockholder value creation and management decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ultimate value of our annual equity grants is driven by stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Shareholder Feedback and Advisory Say on Pay Voting Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In compliance with Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we ask our stockholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this Proxy Statement (commonly known as a Say on Pay proposal).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the advisory Say on Pay votes of our stockholders are an important means by which stockholders may express their views regarding the Company's executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Say on Pay votes are advisory and not binding on the Company, the Compensation Committee strongly values the opinions of the stockholders as expressed in the Say on Pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our compensation program received the support of 80.6% of the total votes cast at our annual meeting compared to 94% in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the 2016 Say on Pay result was disappointing and a clear departure from the results received for the past several years, we acknowledge it is likely related to the specific compensation decisions made to retain our key
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employees during this significant industry downturn and the uncertainty of the eighteen-month pendency of the Halliburton Merger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To address the lower Say on Pay support, following the termination of the Halliburton Merger Agreement in April 2016, the Chair of the Compensation Committee, as well as members of the executive management team, conducted meetings with stockholders holding over 32% of our outstanding Common Stock to discuss the Say on Pay voting results as well as the rationale for our executive pay program in 2015 and the first half of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meetings included discussions on the need o provide compensatory retention and reward incentives given the unique challenges faced by the Company while the Halliburton Merger was pending.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During those meetings, we reiterated the Company's intention to return to a pay for performance model in the second half of 2016 as well as 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Consultant and Conflict of Interest Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has continued to retain Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. ("Cook") as its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook advises the Compensation Committee on matters related to the Senior Executives' compensation and general compensation programs, including industry best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the requirements of Item 407(e)(3)(iv) of Regulation S-K, in 2016 the Compensation Committee considered the relationships Cook has had with the Company, the members of the Compensation Committee and our executive officers, as well as the policies that Cook has in place to maintain its independence and objectivity, and determined that no conflicts of interest arose from the work performed by Cook.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is anticipated that this relationship will continue during the remainder of 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook provides the following consulting services to the Compensation Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assists in the annual review and approval of the comparator groups used to benchmark executive compensation levels;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determining base salaries for Senior Executives  Setting individual performance goals and award levels for Senior Executives for the long-term incentive plan performance cycle
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing compensation trends and regulatory matters affecting compensation  Designing and determining individual grant levels for Senior Executive long-term incentive awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook also periodically provides consulting services to the Governance and HS&E Committee on director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The competition in the market for executive talent magnifies the need to ensure that our executive compensation programs are appropriately positioned against peer companies in order to strengthen our ability to attract, engage and retain key executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to appropriately benchmark compensation and measure performance, the Company utilizes two primary benchmarking sources: (1) compensation Reference Group and (2) performance Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Reference Group is comprised of 20 companies including industry peers and companies in the broader energy and general industry sectors with similar business characteristics, size, margins, competition for talent, and other key compensable factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In selecting the Reference Group, the Company narrows the broad universe of public companies down to a smaller group by considering companies within a size range against which the Company competes for talent as well as business characteristics such as asset intensity and cash flow margin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The list is narrowed further taking into account factors, including but not limited to, global scale, engineering, technology and industrial applications, multiple divisions, logistical complexity, business services, size (and other financial measures) and asset/people intensity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Peer Group is comprised of four oilfield service companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the technical nature of the industry, cyclical nature of the markets, high labor needs and capital requirements, oilfield service companies provide the best competitive comparison for benchmarking performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee conducted a review of the companies included in the Reference Group, considered the impact of the industry downturn particularly with respect to market capitalization and made the decision to maintain the existing group of companies at the current time but to continue monitoring the appropriateness of the Reference Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following chart reflects the Reference Group and Peer Group companies and illustrates how competitive information is used to compare compensation and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reference Group     20 companies - oilfield services, exploration & production, offshore drilling, oil and gas, and general industry:      3M Company  Emerson Electric Co  Raytheon Co      Anadarko Petroleum Co  Halliburton Co  Schlumberger Ltd Compensation   Apache Corp  Hess Corp  Textron Inc      Danaher Corp  Honeywell Intl Inc  Transocean Ltd      Deere & Co  Illinois Tool Works  Weatherford Intl Ltd      Devon Energy Corp  Johnson Controls Inc  Williams Cos Inc      Eaton Corp  National Oilwell Varco       Used to identify and compare executive pay practices such as pay mix and magnitude, competitiveness, prevalence of long-term incentive vehicles, pay-for-performance plans, etc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Group     4 companies - oilfield services only      Halliburton Co  Schlumberger Ltd   Performance   National Oilwell Varco  Weatherford Intl Ltd       Used to compare performance in order to determine long-term incentive plan results and for general performance assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using the Reference Group proxy data as well as published survey data in both the general industry and the energy industry (collectively, the Survey Data) addresses the need for both statistical validity and industry influence in the data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Reference Group data is used to assess the competitive market value for executive jobs, assess pay practices, validate targets for pay plans, test the compensation strategy, observe trends and provide a general competitive backdrop for decision making.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Data concerning the Peer Group is used to conduct a general, high level review, compare Company performance in our industry, understand pay practices and trends, compare plan design specifics, evaluate the effects of the industry cycle on compensation and validate compensation targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Mix
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charts below show the fiscal year 2016 target mix of compensation elements for our executive officers as compared to that of the Reference Group market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This comparison demonstrates that the allocation of our compensation elements is similar to the compensation practices of our Reference Group, but with more weight to long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allocation is aligned with one of our compensation objectives to provide a significant percentage of total compensation that is variable and at risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of the Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews, on an annual basis, each compensation element for the PEO and each of the Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee balances the executive's scope of responsibilities and experience against competitive compensation levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing and approving the Company's goals and objectives relative to the PEO's compensation, evaluating the PEO's performance in light of such goals and objectives and determining the PEO's compensation level based on this evaluation and other relevant information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each year the PEO presents to the Compensation Committee his evaluation of each of the other Senior Executives, which includes a review of each Senior Executive's contribution and performance over the past year, strengths, development needs and succession potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PEO makes no recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following this presentation and a review of the Survey Data, the Compensation Committee makes its own assessments and approves compensation for each Senior Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the Compensation Committee targets the market median of the Reference Group for the base salaries of our Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Typically, when considering an adjustment to a Senior Executive's base salary, the Compensation Committee reviews the Survey Data and evaluates the Senior Executive's position relative to the market, his/her level of responsibility and experience as well as overall Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also considers the Senior Executive's success in achieving business objectives, promoting our core values and keys to success, improving health and safety, demonstrating leadership and achieving specific individual performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining base salaries, the Compensation Committee also considers the Company's continuing achievement of its short and long-term goals including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective execution of the strategy approved by our Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed the compensation for Senior Executives, and given the market conditions at that time, made the decision not to implement salary increases for Senior Executives in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PEO and most Senior Executives have not received salary increases since April 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not conducted a merit cycle since 2014 for employees and has had limited promotions and one-off salary increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, in an effort to manage costs and achieve financial targets in the second half of 2016, employees in the United States, including most Senior Executives, took a temporary 5% salary reduction in the final quarter of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with the implementation of our new organizational structure in May 2016, Messrs. Chariag and Soucy were promoted to roles with significantly expanded scopes as business operations were consolidated under one global operations organization and global product lines were consolidated under one products and technology organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-Term Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive compensation programs are designed to provide Senior Executives with the opportunity to earn cash bonuses based on the achievement of specific Company-wide, business unit, functional and individual performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive compensation opportunity is delivered by way of two incentive programs: the AICPE and the performance scorecard, with greater weight placed on the formula-based component of the short-term incentives consistent with the Company's goal of providing a meaningful link between compensation and Company performance as detailed in the chart below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combined payouts for Senior Executives under the short-term incentive compensation programs are targeted to provide compensation at the market median of the Survey Data in years where we reach target performance levels under both programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, the short-term incentive compensation programs are designed to pay above the market median in years where performance exceeds target performance levels, and below when performance falls short of expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-term incentive bonuses are generally paid in cash in March of each year for the prior fiscal year's performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive target for each Senior Executive is reviewed by the Compensation Committee each year and is set based on the market median of the Survey Data and the individual contribution level and potential of each individual executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the only modifications to incentive target percentages were for Messrs. Chariag and Soucy due to their promotions.

sentences.text: In addition to the above adjustments, management also recommended two downward adjustments to the operating profit for the purpose of determining achievement of second half objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These adjustments included credits and a reversal of accruals that were not in the H2 2016 financial plan which totaled approximately $17 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After these adjustments, the final adjusted operating profit result for incentive purposes was $11.6 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that adjusted operating profit is a widely accepted financial indicator used by investors to compare companies on the basis of operating performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the reconciliation of GAAP measures to non-GAAP measures on Annex C.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted operating profit margin improved 1,440 basis points with margins increasing from (13.8)% for H1 2016 to 0.6% for H2 2016 and ranked first among our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The resulting payout percentage for H2 2016 for Senior Executives was 105.8% and 130.2% for all other plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final 2016 AICPE Payout
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee awarded Mr. Craighead, Ms. Ross, and Messrs. Chariag, Soucy, Mathieson and Crain cash-based awards under the AICPE in the amounts of $913,282, $493,920, $401,487, $260,713, $314,234, and $180,000, respectively, based upon the established performance metrics for the first and second half of 2016 described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Crain was not eligible for the AICPE for the second half of the year per his Letter Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonuses Based on Achievement Against Performance Scorecard
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the AICPE rewards Senior Executives for the achievement of specific formulaic financial measures, the Compensation Committee utilizes a performance scorecard to reward Senior Executives based upon the Compensation Committee's assessment of the achievement of specific performance goals that are critical to the execution of the Company's strategy, but may or may not be formulaic in nature.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the measures for evaluating the Senior Executives' performance with respect to the performance scorecard goals are subject to the Compensation Committee's discretion, the Compensation Committee and the Company establish performance scorecard goals and specific expectations related to the achievement of these goals at the beginning of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the beginning of 2016, the Compensation Committee, with approval from the full Board, established performance scorecard goals for the PEO and then such goals are used to align the annual business objectives for the remaining Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum funds available for the payment of bonuses related to the performance scorecard may not exceed 2.5 times the respective targets for all participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the bonus amounts, the achievement of (or failure to achieve) the performance goals under the AICPE is not a factor that is considered by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee assesses the PEO's performance relative to the established performance goals for the year and determines whether or not a payout will be made to the PEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The same process is conducted for the other Senior Executives taking into account the recommendations from the PEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the process for assessing Company and individual performance under the scorecard, the Committee is given status updates throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Committees January meeting, the PEO discusses the final performance results for the year with the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee carefully considers all of the factors influencing the results and the Senior Executive's performance impacting those results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 performance scorecard goals related to the business objectives of the PEO and his direct reports included improving key health, safety and environment metrics, management through the Halliburton Merger process (H1 only), remaining best in class in operations and compliance, leading in technology and innovation and continuing to strengthen leadership and organizational capabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the termination of the Halliburton Merger Agreement, the Compensation Committee approved two additional goals for the performance scorecard: reducing $500 million of annualized costs by the end of 2016 and implementing organizational changes required by the new strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluated the results achieved for each of the goals established for the performance scorecard and determined whether each goal had been achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered the achievement for the performance goals below for 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Component Beginning of Year Performance Expectation Assessment of Performance for 2016 HSE Enterprise goals Improve HSE Metrics--Preventable Vehicle Accident Rate, Total Recordable Incident Rate and Days Away From Work Case Rate--by 10% from 2015 Actuals Achieved best record in Company history for second consecutive year in spite of extremely difficult business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, an employee fatality occurred, overshadowing an otherwise successful record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cost (added for H2 2016) Reduce $500M of annualized costs by end of 2016 Exceeded the cost reduction goal by reducing annualized costs over $700M Continue Full Support of Effective integration and divestiture Provided full support to the Halliburton Merger until the termination of the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Halliburton Acquisition (H1 2016 only) planning for Halliburton Merger Halliburton Merger Agreement on April 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Received the $3.5 billion merger termination fee within 3 business days of termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Component Beginning of Year Performance Expectation Assessment of Performance for 2016 Operations and Compliance Continue building a culture of flawless execution and operational excellence Maintain legal and financial compliance Fully achieved Technology and Innovation Targeted development, deployment and commercialization of strategic products Achieved goals, including the introduction of nearly 70 new products and services in the second half of 2016 Leadership Continue to strengthen leadership and organizational capabilities - Sales effectiveness - ELT effectiveness Effectively communicate business and integration updates to extended teams Maintain focus on retention and engagement of BHI employees worldwide Implement organizational changes required by new strategy (added for H2 2016) Fully achieved goals including establishing a new executive leadership team within two days of the termination of the Halliburton Merger Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining organizational changes were implemented within 30 days of the termination of the Halliburton Merger Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final Performance Scorecard 2016 Payout
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining the funding pool for the performance scorecard bonus, the Compensation Committee considered not only the achievement of the performance goals above but they also considered additional accomplishments of the Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite the continued downturn in the market and the distractions related to the Merger Agreement with Halliburton and the subsequent termination of the Merger Agreement, Senior Executives reorganized the Company following the termination of the Merger Agreement, effectively used the $3.5 billion breakup fee to optimize the Companys capital structure, focused on the Companys core strength as a product innovator and building a stronger sales organization and maximized shareholder value for the North American Land Pressure Pumping business while continuing to participate in this important market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these considerations, the Compensation Committee determined that Senior Executives significantly exceeded the 2016 strategic performance goals and approved a funding pool of 215% of target for the Performance Scorecard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved a bonus under the program for Mr. Craighead at 215% of target or $1,272,635.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Craighead then determined the bonus amounts for the other plan participants based on his assessment of their contribution towards the achievement of the performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonus payouts were approved under the program for Ms. Ross, and Messrs. Chariag, Soucy, Mathieson and Crain in the amounts of $688,000, $557,263, $361,857, $437,780, and $120,000, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Per his Letter Agreement, Mr. Crain was not eligible for a bonus under the Performance Scorecard for H2 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term incentive program allows Senior Executives to earn compensation over a number of years as a result of sustained financial performance over multiple years and/or of stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our at-risk pay philosophy, long-term incentives comprise the largest portion of a Senior Executive's compensation package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A primary objective of the long-term incentive plan is to align the interests of Senior Executives with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, the long-term incentive compensation has been composed of stock options, restricted stock and cash-based and, beginning in 2014, stock-based performance units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines the total grant date value of long-term incentives to be granted to the Senior Executives as well as the form of long-term incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation vehicles to be utilized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The awards granted to Senior Executives by the Compensation Committee vary each year and are based on factors such as competitive compensation information including the Survey Data, the demand for talent, cost considerations, the performance of the Company, the Senior Executive's performance and total compensation package as well as other factors the Compensation Committee deems critical to achieving the Companys business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted previously, while pay for performance remains a key component in our compensation strategy, for 2016, retaining critical talent in light of the pendency of the Halliburton Merger was an overriding concern.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to this talent retention concern, the long-term incentive awards granted to Senior Executives and all other employees receiving equity grants during the January 2016 award cycle were delivered in the form of service-based restricted stock units to be settled in shares of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock unit awards provide Senior Executives the opportunity for capital accumulation and a more predictable long-term incentive value than stock options or performance-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, restricted stock unit awards are intended to aid in the retention of Senior Executives through the use of a vesting schedule (generally one-third increments annually after the grant date for service-based awards).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2017 award cycle, long-term incentive awards granted to Senior Executives were comprised of 50% performance- based restricted stock units and 50% service-based restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance criteria is based on the Companys ranking on revenue growth and return on capital versus peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below illustrates the grant date target values of the long-term incentive awards granted to Senior Executives in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, in connection with the promotions for Messrs. Chariag and Soucy, the Compensation Committee approved special long-term incentive awards for both as detailed in the chart below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Unit Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance unit awards are designed to motivate the Senior Executives to achieve certain specific Company long-term performance goals during a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance units (settled in stock) are awards of a conditional number of shares with a set target value (e.g., 100 shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final number of shares our Senior Executives may receive under the program depends on how well we perform against the specified peer group with respect to specified performance goals established by the Compensation Committee with assistance from the Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance period for the only remaining open performance unit cycle closed on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the end of each measurement period, our performance is measured against the performance of our peer group members and 25% of the performance unit award value is determined.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final award is then modified based on our relative TSR performance the end of the three-year performance period.

sentences.text: Certain Tax Implications of Short-Term Incentives and Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code) generally places a limit of $1,000,000 on the amount of compensation that may be deducted by the Company in any year with respect to the PEO and the other NEOs other than the PFO unless the compensation is performance-based compensation as described in Section 162(m) of the Code and the related regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally intend that certain compensation paid to Senior Executives should qualify for deductibility as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m), including certain options and certain
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: other long-term performance-based stock or cash awards granted pursuant to the Baker Hughes Incorporated 2002 Director & Officer Long-Term Incentive Plan (the "2002 D&O Plan").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may pay compensation to our Senior Executives that may not be deductible, including discretionary bonuses, bonuses under the AICPE, service-based restricted stock unit awards and certain other types of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe there are circumstances where the Company's interests are best served by maintaining flexibility in the manner in which compensation is provided, even if it might result in the non-deductibility of certain compensation under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although equity awards may be deductible for tax purposes by the Company, the accounting rules pursuant to FASB ASC Topic 718 for fiscal year-end 2016 require that the portion of the tax benefit in excess of the financial compensation cost be recorded to additional paid-in capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer a variety of health and welfare and retirement programs to all eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Senior Executives generally are eligible for the same broad-based benefit programs on the same basis as the rest of the employees who work in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Programs that provide different levels of benefits for Senior Executives are noted in the descriptions below, including long-term disability, life insurance, the Executive Severance Plan, the Supplemental Retirement Plan (the "SRP") and Financial Counseling.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We routinely benchmark our benefits programs against the competitive market and make modifications as we deem appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a description of these programs and benefits for 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health Care
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The health care program provides medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage for employee and eligible covered dependents as well as flexible spending accounts which allow employees to save pre-tax dollars for eligible health care and/or dependent day care expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A health savings account is offered to employees participating in the high deductible health plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, preventive services, including physical exams, are covered at 100% for all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees have access to certain continued medical coverage during retirement (pre-65) if they meet the retirement criteria of age 55 with 10 years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retiree pays the full cost of pre-65 coverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible employees with a Retiree Medical Account balance may use the funds toward the cost of pre-65 or post-65 retiree coverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees who meet defined criteria may be eligible to participate in the Retiree Health Reimbursement Arrangement (the Retiree HRA) following age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retiree HRA is a defined contribution type of retiree medical program under which the Company credits a notional account of an eligible retiree and eligible spouse with an amount determined by the Company each year (currently, approximately $1,600 for each eligible retiree and each eligible spouse for 2016 or the amount of a retirees accrued retiree medical account, if applicable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Disability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term disability program provides continuation of 100% of an employee's base pay for weeks 1-6 and 75% for weeks 7-26 if the employee is out due to injury, illness, or pregnancy and unable to work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term disability program provides continuation of a percentage of the employees base pay up to age 65 if the employee has a qualifying disability lasting longer than 26 weeks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Disability coverage options include Company paid core coverage equal to 50% income replacement or optional buy-up coverage equal to 60% income replacement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives, including Senior Executives, receive the buy-up option at no cost.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Life Insurance and Accidental Death and Dismemberment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment programs provide financial protection for employees or their beneficiaries in the event of death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment coverage at one times pay (two times pay for Executives).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives, including Senior Executives, may purchase additional life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment coverage from 1-6 times pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees have the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: option of purchasing supplemental life insurance, spouse and child life insurance as well as voluntary accidental death and dismemberment insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Various limits apply to each program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Travel Accident Insurance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The business travel accident insurance program provides financial protection to employees or their beneficiaries in the event of accidental death, dismemberment, or paralysis while traveling on Company business in the amount of five times eligible pay up to $3,000,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan is a hybrid defined benefit retirement plan intended to comply with Section 401(a) of the Code that provides for annual pay credits of 2-4% of the first $265,000 of eligible compensation and interest credits based on the 30- year Treasury rate (with a floor interest rate of 2.4% per annum).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Thrift Plan is a defined contribution retirement plan intended to comply with Section 401(a) of the Code that provides for an employer match and an age-based contribution of 5% and 2-5%, respectively, of the first $265,000 of eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the period March 27, 2016 through December 31, 2016, the Company suspended employer match and age-based contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SRP is a nonqualified defined contribution retirement intended to supplement the retirement benefits of a select group of management and provides for a basic contribution of 5% of the participants elective deferral under the SRP and 5% of the sum of the participants base compensation, AICPE and performance scorecard bonus for the calendar year (whether or not deferred) that exceeds the dollar limit under Section 401(A)(17) of the Code ($265,000 in 2016); the applicable age- based contribution that would have been made under the Thrift Plan but for the participants elective deferral under the SRP or the dollar limit under Section 401(A)(17) of the Code; and the applicable age-based contribution that would have been made under the Pension Plan but for the participants elective deferral under the SRP or the dollar limit under Section 401(A)(17) of the Code; plus deemed interest credits based upon the rate of earnings on selected notional investment funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts of the Thrift Plan and SRP contributions and accruals for 2016 for our NEOs are included in the Summary Compensation Table (under the All Other Compensation column).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The changes in values of the Pension Plan actuarial present values of the accumulated benefits of our NEOs are set forth in the Summary Compensation Table (under the Change in Pension Value column).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Stock Purchase Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Employee Stock Purchase Plan (the "ESPP") encourages and enables eligible employees to voluntarily acquire proprietary interests in the Company through the ownership of our Common Stock at a favorable price, thereby aligning their interests with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, employees may contribute 1-10% of base salary after tax up to a maximum contribution of $10,000 per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP generally provides for six month offering periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may purchase our Common Stock at a price of 85% of Fair Market Value of the stock at the beginning or the end of the offering period, whichever is lower.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Severance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Severance Plan provides assistance to Executives, including Senior Executives, while they seek other employment following involuntary separations from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are eligible for 6-18 months of base salary based on their positions in the Company; and outplacement services are provided for 12 months (up to a maximum of $10,000 outplacement services in the aggregate).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Counseling
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to Company-wide benefits, our Senior Executives may elect Company-paid professional financial planning and tax preparation services through a third party.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this service improves their understanding of the compensation and benefits programs offered by the Company and serves to maximize the retention and engagement value of our programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also allows them to more fully concentrate on our business success and comply with plan requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not reimburse executives for taxes paid on income attributable to this benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have entered into change in control agreements (Change in Control Agreements) with the Senior Executives, as well as certain other Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Change in Control Agreements are described in the Payments Upon a Change in Control section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012, the Compensation Committee adopted a new form of Change in Control Agreement that eliminated excise tax gross-up provisions for new hires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indemnification Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We entered into an indemnification agreement with each of our directors and Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements provide that we will indemnify such persons against certain liabilities that may arise by reason of their status or service as directors or officers, to advance their expenses incurred as a result of a proceeding as to which they may be indemnified and to cover such persons under any directors' and officers' liability insurance policy we choose, in our discretion, to maintain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These indemnification agreements are intended to provide indemnification rights to the fullest extent permitted in the State of Delaware and are in addition to any other rights the indemnitee may have under the Company's Restated Certificate of Incorporation, Bylaws and applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these indemnification agreements enhance our ability to attract and retain knowledgeable and experienced Senior Executives and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Board of Directors, upon the Compensation Committee's recommendation, adopted a Stock Ownership Policy for our enior Executives to ensure that they have a meaningful economic stake in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy is designed to satisfy n individual Senior Executive's need for portfolio diversification, while maintaining management stock ownership at levels ntended to be high enough to assure our stockholders of management's commitment to value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the stock wnership level for the Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer was increased from 5x base salary to 6x base alary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Executives are required to hold the number of shares valued at a multiple of their base salary, in the mounts listed below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer 6X Base Salary Senior Vice President reporting to Chief Executive Officer 3X Base Salary Corporate Vice Presidents reporting to Chief Executive Officer 2X Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Senior Executive has five years to comply with the ownership requirement starting from the date of appointment to a position noted above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a Senior Executive is promoted to a position with a higher ownership salary multiple, the Senior Executive has five years from the date of the change in position to reach the higher expected stock ownership level but he or she still must meet the prior expected stock ownership level within the original five years of the date first appointed to such prior position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Executives who have not met the applicable stock ownership level within the time required are required to hold 75% of the net shares acquired from future exercises or vestings through the Company's equity compensation programs until the ownership levels are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net shares are the shares remaining after shares are sold or withheld, as the case may be, to pay any applicable option exercise price and/or satisfy any tax obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee annually reviews each Senior Executive's compensation and stock ownership levels to determine whether they are appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, all of the NEOs were in compliance with the Stock Ownership Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POTENTIAL PAYMENTS UPON CHANGE IN CONTROL OR TERMINATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have entered into Change in Control Agreements with each of the Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements are intended to provide for continuity of management in the event of a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of each agreement is for a three-year period and automatically extends for an additional two years from the effective date of the agreement unless we have given eighteen months prior notice that the agreement will not be extended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the pending Transaction with GE is completed, it will constitute a Change in Control of the Company under the Change in Control Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, for purposes of any long-term incentive awards granted after the date of the Transaction Agreement, the term Change in Control of the Company does not include the consummation of any of the transactions contemplated by the Transaction Agreement except in the event of a termination of employment by the Senior Executive for good reason or by the Company or its successor without cause following the closing of the Transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that point, all remaining forfeiture restrictions applicable to then outstanding long-term incentive awards granted after the date of the Transaction Agreement would immediately lapse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments in the Event of a Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a Change in Control were to have occurred on December 31, 2016, whether or not the Senior Executive incurred a termination of employment in connection with the Change in Control, the Senior Executive would have become entitled to receive the following under the terms of the Change in Control Agreements, the SRP, the AICPE and awards under the 2002 D&O Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all outstanding options to acquire our stock, granted prior to October 30, 2016, would have become fully vested and immediately exercisable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all outstanding restricted stock awards and restricted stock units granted prior to October 30, 2016 would have become fully vested and non-forfeitable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shares equal to the number of performance units (settled in shares and granted prior to October 30, 2016) specified in the Senior Executive's performance unit award agreement, multiplied by the number of days during the performance period through December 31, 2016, divided by the number of days during the performance period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for grandfathered Senior Executives, a lump-sum cash payment (a gross-up payment) in an amount equal to the excise taxes that may be imposed under the golden parachute rules on payments and benefits received in connection with the Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The gross-up payment would make the Senior Executive whole for the excise taxes (and for all taxes on the gross-up payment) in respect of payments and benefits received pursuant to all the Company's plans, agreements and arrangements (including for example, acceleration of vesting of equity awards);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accelerated vesting of all the Senior Executive's accounts under the SRP, to the extent not already vested;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reimbursement for any legal fees and expenses incurred by the Senior Executive in seeking in good faith to enforce the Change in Control Agreement or in connection with any tax audit or proceeding relating to the application of parachute payment excise taxes to any payment or benefit under the Change in Control Agreement; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an amount equal to his/her annual incentive bonus computed as if the target level of performance had been achieved, multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of the Senior Executive's months of participation during the calendar year through the date of Change in Control, and the denominator of which is 12.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, Change in Control means
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the individuals who are incumbent directors cease for any reason to constitute a majority of the members of our Board of Directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments in the Event of a Change in Control and Termination of Employment by the Senior Executive for Good Reason or by the Company or its Successor Without Cause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Change in Control Agreements, the Company (or its successor) will pay severance benefits to a Senior Executive if the Senior Executive's employment is terminated following, or in connection with, a Change in Control, unless:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Senior Executive resigns without good reason;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Company terminated the employment of the Senior Executive for cause; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the employment of the Senior Executive is terminated by reason of death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f a Senior Executive had met the criteria for payment of severance benefits due to the occurrence of an involuntary ermination of employment and a Change of Control on December 31, 2016, the Senior Executive would have become entitled to receive the following benefits in addition to the benefits described above under Payments in the Event of a Change in Control":
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment equal to three times the Senior Executive's highest base salary (as defined in the Change of Control Agreement);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment equal to the Senior Executive's highest bonus amount (as defined in the Change of Control Agreement), prorated based upon the number of days of his/her service during the performance period (reduced by any payments received by the Senior Executive under the Company's annual incentive bonus, in connection with the Change in Control if the Senior Executive's termination of employment occurs during the same calendar year in which the Change in Control occurs);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment equal to three times the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Senior Executive's earned highest bonus amount or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Senior Executive's highest base salary multiplied by the Senior Executive's applicable multiple, which, as of December 31, 2016, was 1.2 for Messrs. Craighead, Soucy, and Mathieson, and 1.0 for Ms. Ross and Mr. Chariag;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all outstanding restricted stock awards and restricted stock units granted on or after October 30, 2016 would have become fully vested and non-forfeitable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continuation of accident and health insurance benefits for an additional three years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment equal to the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the cost of the Senior Executive's perquisites in effect prior to his/her termination of employment for the remainder of the calendar year and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the cost of the Senior Executive's perquisites in effect prior to his/her termination of employment for an additional three years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment equal to the undiscounted value of the benefits the Senior Executive would have received had the Senior Executive continued to participate in the Thrift Plan, the Pension Plan and the SRP for an additional three years, assuming for this purpose that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) the Senior Executive's compensation during that three-year period were his/her highest base salary and highest bonus amount; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment equivalent to 36 multiplied by the monthly basic life insurance premium applicable to the Senior Executive's basic life insurance coverage on the date of termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment of $30,000 for outplacement services; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment equal to the amount of interest that would be earned on any of the foregoing payments subject to a six-month payment delay under Section 409A using the six-month London Interbank Offered Rate plus two percentage points, excluding Mr. Chariag.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an amount equal to the Senior Executive's earned annual incentive bonus, prorated based upon the number of months of the Senior Executive's participation in the annual incentive bonus during the calendar year.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all outstanding stock options granted by us would have become fully vested and exercisable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shares equal to the number of performance units (settled in shares) specified in the Senior Executive's performance unit award agreement, multiplied by the number of days during the performance period through December 31, 2016, divided by the number of days during the performance period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accelerated vesting of all the Senior Executive's accounts under the SRP, to the extent not already vested; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an amount equal to the Senior Executive's earned annual incentive bonus, prorated based upon the number of months of the Senior Executive's participation in the annual incentive bonus during the calendar year.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Baker Hughes Executive Severance Plan provides for payment of certain benefits to the Senior Executives as a resul of an involuntary termination of employment provided that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the executive signs a release agreement substantially similar to the form of release agreement set forth in the Executive Severance Plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) during the two-year period commencing on the date of termination of employment, the Senior Executive complies with the non-competition and non-solicitation agreements contained in the Executive Severance Plan and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the executive does not disclose our confidentia information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any amounts payable under the Executive Severance Plan are reduced by the amount of any severance payments payable to the Senior Executive by us under any other plan, program or individual contractual arrangement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Senior Executive meets the criteria for payment of severance benefits due to an involuntary termination, we will pay the Senior Executive the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum cash payment equal to one and one-half times the Senior Executive's annual base salary in effect immediately prior to his/her termination of employment;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: outplacement services for a period of 12 months, but not in excess of $10,000; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if the Senior Executive's termination of employment results from a reduction of employment or the elimination of the Senior Executive's job, an amount equal to the Senior Executive's earned annual incentive bonus, prorated based upon the number of months of the Senior Executive's participation in the annual incentive bonus during the calendar year.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the Senior Executive ncurred a termination of employment by us for cause, the Senior Executive would also have been entitled to any vested outstanding stock options.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company entered into a letter agreement with Mr. Alan R. Crain, effective July 29, 2016 (the Letter Agreement).

sentences.text: The Letter Agreement outlines the terms of Mr. Crains retirement, which occurred on December 29, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Letter Agreement generally provides that while employed, Mr. Crain would continue to receive his base salary and employee benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was eligible for a short-term performance bonus for the first six months of 2016 under both the AICPE and the performance scorecard bonus program, both of which were guaranteed in the aggregate amount of $300,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was not eligible for a short-term bonus under either the AICPE or the performance scorecard bonus program for the second half of 2016 but was paid a fixed $300,000 bonus for this period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon retirement, he was eligible for certain retirement benefits, including a separation payment of $1,170,000, an additional payment of $375,000 in consideration of a non-compete agreement, and the accelerated vesting of restricted stock awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Letter Agreement provides that Mr. Crain is not entitled to any severance benefits under any change in control arrangement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, Mr. Crain would not be entitled to any payments or benefits that are based on or otherwise relate to the subsequent Transaction with GE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Letter Agreement is subject to a one-year non-solicitation and confidentiality restriction and a two-year non-compete agreement.
