sentences.text: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee held eight meetings during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed the Compensation Discussion and Analysis with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon such review, the related discussions and such other matters deemed relevant and appropriate by the Compensation Committee, the Compensation Committee has recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be ncluded in this Proxy Statement to be delivered to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anthony G. Fernandes (Chair) Clarence P. Cazalot, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: William H. Easter III Claire W. Gargalli Pierre H. Jungels
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE INTERLOCKS AND INSIDER PARTICIPATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the Compensation Committee consisted of Messrs. Fernandes (Chair), Cazalot, Easter and Jungels and Ms. Gargalli, all of whom were independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the members of the Compensation Committee who served during 2016 has served as an officer or employee of the Company and none of the Company's executive officers has served as a member of a compensation committee or board of directors of any other entity which has an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executive officer serving as a member of the Company's Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 2 ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010, or the Dodd-Frank Act, enables our stockholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement in accordance with the SEC's rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposal, commonly known as a Say on Pay proposal, gives our stockholders the opportunity to express their views on the Company's executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because this is an advisory vote, this proposal is not binding upon the Company; however, the Compensation Committee, which is responsible for designing and administering the Company's executive compensation program, values the opinions expressed by stockholders in their vote on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our compensation policies and decisions are focused on pay for performance principles, as well as being strongly aligned with the long-term interests of our stockholders and being competitive in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed previously in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section, while modifications were made for our 2016 compensation programs in light of challenges to retain a strong talent base in the current environment and while under the Halliburton Merger Agreement, the Company remains committed to our long-term pay for performance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's principal compensation policies, which enable the Company to attract and retain strong and experienced senior executives, include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: rewarding performance that supports the Company's core values of integrity, teamwork, performance, learning and courage;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing a significant percentage of total compensation that is variable because it is at risk, based on predetermined performance criteria;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: requiring significant stock holdings to align the interests of senior executives with those of stockholders;  designing competitive total compensation and rewards programs to enhance our ability to attract and retain knowledgeable and experienced senior executives; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: setting compensation and incentive levels that reflect competitive market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our stockholders to indicate their support for our named executive officer compensation program as described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is an advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is not intended to address any specific item of compensation, but rather the overall compensation of our named executive officers and the philosophy, policies and practices described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we ask our stockholders to vote FOR the following resolution at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Company's stockholders approve, on an advisory basis, the named executive officer compensation, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion & Analysis, compensation tables and narrative disclosures, of the SEC's rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation programs of our named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion & Analysis, compensation tables and narrative disclosures, of the SEC's rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 3 ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF THE HOLDING OF AN ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMEPNSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in Proposal 2 above, in accordance with Section 14A of the Exchange Act, our stockholders are being provided the opportunity to cast an advisory vote to approve the compensation program of our NEOs, referred to as a say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proposal 3 provides our stockholders the opportunity to cast an advisory vote on how often we should include a say-on-pay vote in our proxy materials for future annual stockholder meetings (or special stockholder meetings for which we must include executive compensation information in the proxy statement for that meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this Proposal 3, our stockholders may vote to have the say-on-pay vote every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders may also abstain from voting on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that a say-on-pay vote should be conducted every year so that our stockholders may express their views on our executive compensation program and our Compensation Committee can consider the outcome of these votes in making its decisions on executive compensation annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are not voting to approve or disapprove our Boards recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, you may cast your vote on your preferred voting frequency by choosing any of the following four options with respect to this proposal: ONE YEAR,  TWO YEARS, THREE YEARS or ABSTAIN.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option of one year, two years, or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast by stockholders will be considered as the frequency for the non-binding advisory vote on executive compensation that has been selected by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because the vote is advisory and not binding on the Board of Directors or the Company in any way, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of the stockholders and the Company to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation more or less frequently than the option that receives the highest number of votes by our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board of Directors recommends a vote for a frequency of "ONE YEAR" for future non-binding stockholder votes to approve the compensation of the Company's executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT/ETHICS COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee is comprised of three members, each of whom is independent, as defined by the standards of the NYSE, the rules of the SEC, and under the Company's policy for director independence (Policy for Director Independence).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Charter of the Audit/Ethics Committee, the Audit/Ethics Committee assists the Board of Directors in overseeing matters relating to the accounting and reporting practices of the Company, the adequacy of the Company's disclosure controls and internal controls, the quality and integrity of the quarterly and annual financial statements of the Company, the performance of the Company's internal audit function and the review and pre-approval of the current year audit and non-audit fees with the Company's Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee also oversees the Company's policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management and compliance programs relating to legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year ended December 31, 2016, the Audit/Ethics Committee held eight meetings and otherwise met and communicated with management and with Deloitte & Touche LLP (Deloitte & Touche), the Company's Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deloitte & Touche discussed with the Audit/Ethics Committee various matters under applicable auditing standards, including information regarding the scope and results of the audit and other matters required to be discussed by Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) Auditing Standard No. 1301, Communications with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee also discussed with Deloitte & Touche its independence from the Company and received the written disclosures and the letter from Deloitte & Touche concerning independence as required by the PCAOB Ethics and Independence Rule 3526, Communication with Audit Committees Concerning Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee also reviewed the provision of services by Deloitte & Touche not related to the audit of the Company's financial statements and not related to the review of the Company's interim financial statements as it pertains to the independence of Deloitte & Touche.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deloitte & Touche also periodically reported the progress of its audit of the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee reviewed and discussed with management the Company's financial results prior to the release of earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit/Ethics Committee reviewed and discussed with management, the Company's internal auditors and Deloitte & Touche, the interim financial information included in the March 31, 2016, June 30, 2016 and September 30, 2016 Form 10-Qs prior to their being filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee also reviewed and discussed the Company's audited financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016 with management, the Company's internal auditors and Deloitte & Touche.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deloitte & Touche informed the Audit/Ethics Committee that the Company's audited financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016 are presented fairly, in all material respects, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deloitte & Touche also informed the Audit/Ethics Committee that the Company maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on the criteria established in Internal Control - Integrated Framework (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit/Ethics Committee also monitored and reviewed the Company's procedures and policies relating to the requirements of Section 404 of SOX and related regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review and discussions referred to above, and such other matters deemed relevant and appropriate by the Audit/Ethics Committee, the Audit/Ethics Committee recommended to the Board of Directors, and the Board has approved, that the financial statements be included in the Company's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James A. Lash (Chairman) Gregory D. Brenneman J. Larry Nichols
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit fees include fees related to the audit of the Company's annual financial statements, including fees related to the statutory audit requirements of most of our subsidiaries in foreign countries, review of quarterly financial statements and audit services related to the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting.

sentences.text: Tax fees are primarily for the preparation of income, payroll, value added and various other miscellaneous tax returns in 36 of the more than 80 countries where the Company operates.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 5 STOCKHOLDER PROPOSAL REGARDING A MAJORITY VOTE STANDARD FOR ALL NON-BINDING STOCKHOLDER PROPOSALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following proposal was submitted to Baker Hughes by Newground Social Investment, SPC (with an address of 10033 12th Avenue NW, Seattle, Washington 98177) on behalf of the Equality Network Foundation, who is the owner of 65 shares of the Companys Common Stock, and is included in this Proxy Statement in compliance with SEC rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposed resolution and supporting statement, for which the Board of Directors and the Company accept no esponsibility, are set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: Baker Hughes Incorporated ("Baker Hughes") shareholders ask the Board to take or initiate steps to amend Company governing documents to provide that all non-binding matters presented by shareholders shall be decided by a simple majority of the votes cast FOR and AGAINST an item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy would apply to all such matters unless shareholders have approved higher thresholds, or applicable laws or stock exchange regulations dictate otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal seeks greater transparency, clarity, and understanding around how informed stockholders vote on shareholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In voting, the meaning of "Abstain" is defined by the Oxford English dictionary as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To formally decline to vote either FOR or AGAINST a proposal...
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A "simple majority" formula, therefore, includes votes cast FOR and AGAINST (but not abstentions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It provides the most democratic, clear, and accurate picture of the intent of shareowners who are both informed and decided, while not including the votes of those who, by definition, have declined to express an opinion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When voters choose to mark ABSTAIN (whether they are confused, disinterested, or lack time to become fully informed), it is apparent that their votes should be regarded as neither FOR nor AGAINST a proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Baker Hughes unilaterally counts ABSTAIN votes as if AGAINST every shareholder item
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Is it reasonable for Baker Hughes to assert it knows the will of undecided voters (and to artificially construe abstentions in favor of management)?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has written as if its use of the Delaware "default standard" (which includes abstentions) is obligatory.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Delaware does not mandate this nominal 'standard' - it is assigned when companies do not proactively choose "simple majority" voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Half our Company's peers use a simple majority formula, and GE, our merger partner, also strikes abstentions from voting Formulas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Research demonstrates that the so-called 'default standard' systematically disadvantages shareholders: http://blt.ly/Voting-Research Corporate-Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It does this by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depressing the appearance of support for stockholder concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The math is simple: When abstaining shareholders decline to express an opinion, but instead are treated as if they voted AGAINST a proposal, the tally is lowered and Baker Hughes benefits (because it routinely opposes stockholder proposals).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subverting vote outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, these practices have allowed companies to describe numerous true majority votes on shareholder proposals as, instead, having 'failed'.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distorting communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual meetings offer the sole opportunity for most shareholders to communicate with Boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Counting abstentions as de facto votes AGAINST shareholder proposals, management changes how outcomes are reported and how the public perceives support for stockholder concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contrast to how shareholder proposals are treated, Baker Hughes' Director Election (where management prefers the appearance of strong support) does not count abstentions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, management and shareholder proposals are not treated "equally" or "identically"; though Baker Hughes has complete discretion over such voting inconsistencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To avert voting discrepancies like these, the Council of Institutional Investors has declared: "...abstentions should be counted only for purposes of a quorum."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THEREFORE:     Support fairness, accuracy, and good governance at Baker Hughes - vote FOR this simple majority proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote AGAINST the stockholder proposal regarding a simple majority vote standard for all non-binding stockholder proposals for these reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Opposition Statement of the Company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is committed to strong corporate governance and it is its fiduciary duty to act in the best interests of the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider every proposed governance change carefully, taking into account company- specific facts and circumstances, together with significant stockholder engagement and input.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also consider the possible interaction among governance features, including recently implemented or proposed corporate governance changes, in order to avoid unintended consequences to the Company and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recent years, we have taken several steps to change our corporate governance policies as corporate governance standards have evolved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These actions include, but are not limited to: declassifying our Board of Directors; requiring the Companys corporate secretary to call special stockholder meetings following a request from the holders of 25% of the Companys voting stock; and implementing a majority voting standard in uncontested director elections, along with a resignation policy for incumbent directors who do not receive a majority vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through these and other actions, the Board has consistently and continuously demonstrated its commitment to good corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our vote counting methodology is consistent with Delaware law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Baker Hughes is incorporated in the State of Delaware.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Delaware General Corporation Law (the DGCL) governs the voting standards applicable to actions taken by our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These standards do not prevent corporate change and growth; rather they are in place to ensure that fundamental changes to our corporate governance procedures only occur when a broad consensus of stockholders exists.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our current majority voting standard is consistent with current corporate governance best practices and helps to protect against actions by short-term or private interest-driven stockholders seeking to promote their own agendas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, with our open stockholder engagement policies and practices, we believe that strong channels of communication clearly exist for the Board and management to stay abreast of our stockholders concerns and interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 216(2) of the DGCL states that, unless otherwise specified by a corporations certificate of incorporation or bylaws, when a quorum is present, the affirmative vote of the majority of shares present in person or represented by proxy at the meeting and entitled to vote is required to approve any matter brought before the meeting of stockholders, other than the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By adopting this as the default standard, the DGCL acknowledges that any shares that abstain from voting on such matters constitute shares that are present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, in the vote tabulation for matters that require the affirmative vote of a majority of shares present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote, abstentions are not included in the numerator (because they are not votes for the matter) but are included in the denominator as shares entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Or, more simply, shares abstaining have the practical effect of being voted against the matter under the default voting standard established by the DGCL.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delaware corporations are permitted to use their discretion to determine their voting practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While it is true that the DGCL does not mandate the use of this exact standard, it does require that Delaware corporations adopt at least this
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: standard as the default standard for voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anything beyond this standard is at the corporations discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is proactive in ensuring that it remains familiar with corporate governance developments and the policies adopted by our peers, including those pertaining to voting standards applicable to actions taken by our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we have exercised the discretion afforded to us by the DGCL and have determined that the default standard set forth in Section 216(2) of the DGCL is best suited for addressing the concerns and capturing the intent of our stockholders in casting votes on matters presented at annual stockholder meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supporting statement to the proposal notes that our merger partner, General Electric (GE) adopts a standard whereby abstentions are not included in the vote counts that determine shareholder action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the voting policies of GE, a New York corporation, are governed by the New York Business Corporation Law (NYBCL).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 614 of the NYBCL adopts a different default standard from that of the DGCL, which focuses only on votes for or against and ignores abstain votes for purposes of vote counting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, GEs voting standard is consistent with the default standard set by its governing authority, as ours is.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our vote counting methods apply identically to stockholder-sponsored and management-sponsored proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions from voting are treated the same for both management and stockholder proposals: they are counted and have he same effect as a vote against the relevant proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws provide only one exception to this, for the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the proponents proposal calls for a simple majority vote to determine all non-binding matters presented by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this proposal is approved, it would not affect the vote counting policies for proposals concerning the election of directors or proposals submitted by management, and would only impact those proposals submitted by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As it stands, our voting policy applies in the same manner to both management proposals and stockholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in our 2016 Proxy Statement, management sponsored a policy to approve the advisory resolution on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstention votes had the same effect as they did on stockholder sponsored proposals that we included in the 2016 Proxy Statement-they uniformly counted as votes against the proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, the vote counting method we use does not favor management-sponsored proposals over stockholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They are, in fact, treated equally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are transparent about our voting policies, and stockholders are aware of the treatment and effect of abstentions; counting abstention votes honors the intent of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders typically have three voting choices for a particular proposal: for, against and abstain".
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our Proxy Statement we describe how each of these voting choices will be treated in tabulating votes, including the counting of abstentions, and the vote required to approve each proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders are informed that if they vote abstain on a matter other than the election of directors, their vote will have the practical effect of a vote against the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, when voters choose to mark abstain on their ballots, they are aware of the impact that this will have on the overall vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating the results of our stockholder votes, we review the number of for, against, and abstain votes cast and consider this when determining the support that a particular proposal has received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because stockholders are informed that an abstain vote has the effect of voting against a particular proposal, stockholders who affirmatively cast an abstain vote seek to send a different message from those who cast an against vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, the proxy voting guidelines published by certain stockholder groups and institutions recommend abstain votes under specified circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proponents proposal would disregard such abstain votes, and potentially disenfranchise those stockholders and others who make the informed choice to abstain on a particular matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To review our description of vote counting, including the treatment of abstentions, please see "Voting Securities on page 4 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our voting policies are consistent with those of our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted on page 24 above, our Peer Group consists of us and four other companies identified by the Compensation Committee as being our main industry competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of these companies, three out of four adopt the same voting policy that we adopt (i.e., that abstain votes are counted as votes against any matter being considered at a meeting of stockholders, with the exception of the election of directors), contrary to the proponents statement that half of our peers use a simple majority formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changing the voting procedure would not be in the best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proponents proposal advocates lowering the approval standard for stockholder voting (that is, making approval easier) by ignoring abstentions in vote tabulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we believe that changing the required approval standards for proposals would not be in the best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our view that, except with respect to the election of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: directors and matters that require, statutorily or otherwise, a different vote, the onus should be on the proponents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of a proposal, whether management or a stockholder, to be able to persuade a majority of those present and eligible to vote to affirmatively vote for the matter for it to be approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Simply because a proponent is unable to do this does not warrant a change in a widely-adopted voting policy to a policy that would artificially inflate the significance of votes for a particular matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our voting standard protects stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proponents proposal states that the voting practices we currently adopt systematically disadvantages stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reality, our voting standard is actually a safeguard for our stockholders against actions by short-term or self-interested stockholders who may, at times, pursue narrow agendas irrespective of the best interests of the Company or the Companys stockholders as a group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the vote standard were based only on for and against votes, decisions on matters that did not attract significant voter participation could be made by small percentages of stockholders representing narrow interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our standard, because it applies equally to management proposals other than the election of directors, ensures that management proposals also cannot be approved without significant support from stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Faced with similar proposals in 2016, stockholders overwhelmingly did not support the adoption of the proposed vote counting methodology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, eight companies included a proposal related to a simple majority vote counting methodology from Investor Voice, Newground Social Investment or the Equality Network Foundation in their annual meeting proxy statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of those proposals (except one, whose results were not disclosed) received less than 15% support from stockholders, with the majority receiving under 10% support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Equality Network Foundation submitted a similar proposal for inclusion in our 2016 Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When put to a shareholder vote, this proposal received the support of only 7.23% of the votes cast at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also note that based on our review of prior annual meeting voting results, the counting of abstention votes as shares entitled to vote has not been determinative of the outcome of any stockholder proposal submitted at our annual stockholder meetings in recent years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we are committed to strong corporate governance practices, we do not believe that this proposal will enhance our governance in any meaningful way.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the foregoing reasons, the Board of Directors recommends a vote AGAINST the stockholder proposal regarding a majority vote standard for all non-binding stockholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNEX A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BAKER HUGHES INCORPORATED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE GUIDELINES (As Amended and Restated January 26, 2017)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Baker Hughes Incorporated Corporate Governance Guidelines are established by the Board of Directors (Board) as the principles for conduct of the Companys business affairs to benefit its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The responsibility of the members of the Board is to exercise their business judgment to act in what they reasonably believe to be in the best interest of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Boards general oversight of managements performance of its responsibilities, the principal functions of the Board acting directly or through its Committees (as defined in Committees of the Board) include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing effective oversight of the governance of the affairs of the Company in order to maximize long-term benefit to the stockholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appointing, approving the compensation and overseeing the work of the independent auditors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing quarterly earnings release and quarterly and annual financial statements to be filed with the Securitie and Exchange Commission (SEC);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adopting an appropriate governance policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Selection and Qualification of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and Health, Safety and Environmental Committee (the Governance and HS&E Committee) will annually assess the needs of the Company and the Board in order to recommend to the Board the director candidates who will further the goals of the Company in representing the long-term interests of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Governance and HS&E Committee will assess the special skills, expertise and backgrounds relevant to the Companys business to determine whether or not a candidate has the character traits and breadth of business knowledge to make him or her an effective director, based on previously established criteria, as described in Exhibit A, Guidelines for Membership on the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee will annually assess the contributions of the directors whose terms expire at the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders and recommend to the Board if they should be nominated for re- election by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will propose a slate of nominees to the stockholders for election to the Board at the next Annual Meeting, as described in Exhibit B, Selection Process for New Board of Directors Candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will be comprised of a majority of directors who qualify as independent directors under the listing standards of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), as described in Exhibit C, Policy for Director Independence, Audit/Ethics Committee Members and Audit Committee Financial Expert.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Board will review the relationship that each director has with the Company to determine that the director has no material relationship with the Company, its affiliates or any member of the senior management of the Company, subject to additional qualifications prescribed under the listing standards of the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will not make any personal loans or extensions of credit to directors or executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Size and Term of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the Companys Bylaws, the Board determines the number of directors on the Board, which currently will consist of not more than 12 directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the Companys Restated Certificate of Incorporation, at each Annual Meeting of Stockholders, directors shall be elected for a term of one year ending on the date of the Annual Meeting of Stockholders following the annual meeting at which the directors were elected and will serve until their successors are elected and qualified or until his or her earlier death, retirement, resignation or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may propose nominees for consideration by the Governance and HS&E Committee, as described in Exhibit D, Policy and Submission Procedures for Stockholder Recommended Director Candidates, by submitting within the prescribed time period the name and supporting information to: Chairman, Governance and HS&E Committee of the Board of Directors, P.O. Box 4740, Houston, Texas 77210-4740 or to the Corporate Secretary, c/o Baker Hughes Incorporated 17021 Aldine Westfield Road, Houston, Texas 77073 to be properly nominated before the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders, although the Company is not required to include such nominees in its proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Between such annual meetings, the Board may elect directors to serve until the next annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any nominee for director in an uncontested election who receives a withhold vote representing a majority of the votes cast for his or her election will be required to submit a letter of resignation to the Governance and HS&E Committee of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee will consider all of the relevant facts and circumstances and recommend to the Board of Directors whether or not the resignation should be accepted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the purposes of this Section, an uncontested election shall mean an election in which the number of nominees as of the record date for the meeting at which directors are to be elected does not exceed the number of directors to be elected at such meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Orientation and Continuing Education
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee will periodically review and recommend to the Board a director orientation program that includes an initial and continuing orientations providing the director with comprehensive information about he Companys business, one-on-one meetings with senior management and other officers of the Company, an overview of the Director Reference Manual and tours of the Companys operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors will be provided with continuing education materials covering upcoming seminars and conferences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Committees of the Board have the right at any time to retain independent outside financial, legal or other advisors.

sentences.text: The Board will meet in executive session with the CEO after each Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the independent directors of the Company will meet in executive session following each regularly scheduled Board meeting without any inside director or Company executives present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These executive session discussions may include any topic relevant to the business affairs of the Company as determined by the independent directors.

sentences.text: Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee will review and recommend to the Board a director to serve as Lead Director during executive sessions of the independent members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director will be elected by the independent members of the Board; preside at all meetings of the Board of Directors at which the Chairman is not present, including executive sessions of independent directors; serve as liaison between the Chairman and the independent directors; have the authority to call meetings of the independent directors; work with the Chairman in developing Board meeting agendas, schedules, and information provided to the Board; and communicate with significant stockholders when appropriate on matters involving broad corporate policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Communications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to provide the stockholders of the Company and other interested parties with a direct and open line of communication to the Companys Board, procedures have been established, as described in Exhibit E, Stockholder Communications with the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of Independent Director Status
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the Companys Bylaws, an independent director shall not stand for reelection as a director of the Company at the Annual Meeting following any of the occurrences set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following provisions may be waived by the Board (excluding the affected director) if the Board determines that such waiver would be in the best interest of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement: The director's 75th birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance: Any fiscal year in which a director fails to attend at least 66% of the meetings of the Board and any Committees of the Board on which the director serves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of Inside Director Status
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the Companys Bylaws, an inside director must resign from the Board:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) at the time of any diminution of his or her responsibilities as an officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) at the time of termination of employment by the Company for any reason; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) on the annual meeting date following the directors 75th birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conflict of Interest
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board expects each director, as well as senior management and employees, to act ethically at all times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent directors may not serve on more than four other boards of publicly listed companies in addition to the Companys Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No officer of the Company may serve on a board of any company having a present or retired employee on the companys Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, officers of the Company may not serve as directors of any other publicly held companies without the approval of the Governance and HS&E Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO may serve on no more than three boards of publicly held companies, while other officers may serve on no more than one board of a publicly held company or for-profit company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of Audit/Ethics Committee of the Board may not simultaneously serve on the audit committees of more than three public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an independent director serving on the Companys Board is asked to join another board of directors, prior notice shall be given to the Chairman of the Governance and HS&E Committee and the Corporate Secretary of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an actual or potential conflict of interest arises for a director or senior management, the individual shall promptly inform the CEO or the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any waivers of the Companys Business Code of Conduct for a director or senior management will be determined by the Board or its designated Committee and will be publicly disclosed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Compensation and Evaluation Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation: The Governance and HS&E Committee will annually review director compensation and recommend any changes to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluation: Any director may at any time provide the Chairman of the Governance and HS&E Committee an evaluation of another director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Questions and observations regarding the evaluation of a director will be referred, as necessary, to the Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors will perform an annual evaluation on the performance and effectiveness of the Audit/Ethics Committee in accordance with the regulations of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Functions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Meetings: The Board will hold five regular meetings per year to handle recurring business, with special meetings called as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to attend all scheduled Board and     Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special Meetings: The number of scheduled Board meetings will vary with circumstances and special meetings will be
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: called as necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Meetings of Stockholders: The Companys Annual Meeting of Stockholders provides an opportunity each year for stockholders to ask questions of or otherwise communicate directly with members of the Companys Board on matters relevant to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the Companys policy to request and encourage all of the Companys directors and nominees for election as directors to attend in person the Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Agenda Items: The Chairman will be responsible for setting the agenda for and presiding over the Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ndividual directors are encouraged to contact the Chairman with respect to any proposed agenda items that the director believes should be on the agenda.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary will endeavor to timely provide to the directors all written Board materials to be covered in regular meetings prior thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committees of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has constituted five standing Committees: Governance and HS&E Committee, Audit/Ethics Committee, Compensation Committee, Finance Committee and Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Committee shall be comprised solely of independent directors, except for the Executive and Finance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board serves on the Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any independent member of the Board may attend any Committee meeting as an observer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and HS&E Committee annually proposes Committee assignments and chairmanships to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Committee member is elected by the Board, including the designation by the Board of one person to serve as Chairman of each Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, each Committee shall perform an evaluation of the Committee and its activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance and HS&E Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose: The Committees purpose is to develop and recommend to the Board a set of corporate governance principles applicable to the Company (Corporate Governance Guidelines) and to oversee compliance with, conduct reviews of and recommend appropriate modifications to such Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is also responsible for assisting the Board of Directors in providing oversight of the Companys policies and management systems with respect to health, safety and environmental matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Responsibilities: The Committee will have the oversight responsibility for recruiting and recommending candidates for election to the Board, with advice of the Companys Chairman and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will periodically conduct a review of criteria for Board membership against current needs of the Board to ensure timeliness of the criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will also be responsible for monitoring compliance with these Corporate Governance Guidelines adopted by the Board, and updating such guidelines when appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will also review and recommend director compensation to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees Charter shall be posted on the Companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall be responsible for reviewing and, as appropriate, recommending changes to the health, safety and environmental policies of the Company and shall monitor compliance with such policies including related legislation and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition: The Committee will be comprised of not less than three nor more than six directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Committee will be independent, as that term is defined in the NYSE corporate governance listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings: The Committee will meet at least two times per year as determined by the Board with special meetings called by the Board or the Committee as necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit/Ethics Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose: The Committees purpose is to assist the Board with oversight of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the integrity of the Companys financial statements and reporting system,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Companys compliance with legal and regulatory requirements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the independent auditors qualifications and independence, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the performance of the Companys internal audit function and independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Responsibilities: The principal responsibilities of the Committee are: (i) to provide assistance to the Board in fulfilling its responsibility in matters relating to the accounting and reporting practices of the Company, the adequacy of the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companys internal controls over financial reporting and disclosure controls and procedures; and the quality and integrity of the financial statements of the Company; and (ii) to oversee the Companys compliance programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ndependent auditor is ultimately accountable to the Board and the Committee, as representatives of the Companys stockholders, and shall report directly to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the ultimate authority and direct responsibility to select, appoint, evaluate, compensate and oversee the work, and, if necessary, terminate and replace the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall conduct or authorize investigations into any matters within its scope of responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall engage independent counsel and other advisors, as the Committee deems necessary to carry out its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the sole authority to approve the fees paid to any independent advisor retained by the Committee, and the Company will provide funding for such payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall provide funding for ordinary administrative expenses of the Committee that are necessary or appropriate in carrying out its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will review the composition, expertise and availability of the Committee members on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will also perform a self-evaluation of the Committee and its activities on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will meet in executive session at each regularly scheduled meeting, including separate, private meetings with the independent auditors, internal auditors, general counsel and compliance officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees Charter shall be posted on the Companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees compliance responsibilities will include the recommendation of and monitoring of compliance with the Companys Business Code of Conduct and Foreign Corrupt Practices Act Policy, establishing formal procedures for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints received by the Company regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or audit matters,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the confidential, anonymous submissions by Company employees of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing matters, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the protection of reporting employees from retaliation as described in Exhibit F, Procedures for the Receipt, Retention and Treatment of Complaints; reviewing in conjunction with counsel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any legal matters that could have significant impact on the organizations financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) correspondence and material inquiries received from regulators or governmental agencies; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) all matters relating to the ethics of the Company and its subsidiaries; coordinate the Companys compliance with inquiries from any government officials concerning legal compliance in the areas covered by the Business Code of Conduct and the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act Policy; and review the Companys compliance with its environmental policy on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition: The Committee will be comprised of not less than three non-employee directors who are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) independent (as defined by Section 10A(m)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the regulations thereunder and the NYSE) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) financially literate (as interpreted by the Board in its business judgment).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such Committee members may not simultaneously serve on the audit committee of more than three publicly held companies, including the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least one member of the Committee will have accounting or related financial management expertise and at least one member of the Committee will be an audit committee financial expert, as defined by the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The audit committee financial expert must have: an understanding of GAAP and financial statements; experience in the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) preparation, auditing, analyzing or evaluating of financial statements of generally comparable issuers and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) application of such principles in connection with the accounting for estimates, accruals and reserves; an understanding of internal accounting controls and procedures for financial reporting; and an understanding of audit committee functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings: The Committee meets at least five times per year as determined by the Board, with special meetings called by the Board or the Committee as necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose: The purpose of the Compensation Committee will be to discharge the Boards responsibilities relating to compensation of the Companys executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will have overall responsibility for reviewing and evaluating and, as applicable, approving the officer compensation plans of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is also the purpose of the Committee to produce an annual report on executive compensation for inclusion in the Companys proxy statement for the Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Responsibilities: The principal responsibility of the Committee will be to ensure that the senior executives of the Company are compensated effectively in a manner consistent with the stated compensation strategy of the Company, internal equity considerations and competitive practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will also communicate to the stockholders of the Company, the Companys compensation policies and the reasoning behind such policies as required by the rules and regulations of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These responsibilities include reviewing from time to time and approving the Companys stated compensation strategy to ensure that management is rewarded appropriately for its contributions to Company growth and profitability and that the executive compensation strategy supports organization objectives and stockholder interests; reviewing compensation programs to ensure that such programs do not encourage
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: unnecessary or unreasonable risk; reviewing and approving corporate goals and objectives relevant to CEO compensation, evaluating the CEOs performance in light of those goals and objectives, and determining the CEOs compensation level based on this evaluation; reviewing annually and determining the individual elements of total compensation of the CEO, including annual salary, annual bonus and long-term incentive compensation, and reporting such determination to the Board, provided, however, that the salary, bonus and other long-term incentive compensation will be subject to the approval of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviews the outcome of the stockholder advisory vote on senior executive compensation when making future compensation decisions for executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews with the CEO matters relating to management succession.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees Charter shall be posted on the Companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition: The Committee will be comprised of not less than three nor more than six of its independent and non- employee members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such directors will meet the requirements for independent pursuant to the listing standards of the NYSE and shall meet the requirements for disinterested independent directors pursuant to Rule 16b-3 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings: The Committee will meet at least three times per year as determined by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose: The Committees purpose will be to review and monitor the financial structure of the Company to determine that it is consistent with the Companys requirements for growth and fiscally sound operation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Responsibilities: The Committee will be responsible for the review and approval of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) public offerings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) debt and other financings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) review and recommend to the Board any dividend changes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) budget and long-range plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) credit facilities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) foreign exchange exposure and derivative contracts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee will periodically review the Companys activities with credit rating agencies, its policy governing approval levels for capital expenditures and funding thereof and its investment policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees Charter shall be posted on the Companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition: The Committee will be comprised of not less than three nor more than six of its non-employee members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings: The Committee will meet at least two times per year as determined by the Board with special meetings called by the Board or the Committee as necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Responsibilities: The Committee will act in the stead of the Board during intervals between Board meetings and may exercise all of the authority of the Board in the business and affairs of the Company, except where action by the full Board is specifically required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More specifically, the Committee will be responsible for advising and aiding the officers of the Company in all matters concerning its interests and the management of its business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the Board is not in session, the Committee has and may exercise all the powers of the Board, so far as such may be delegated legally, with reference to the conduct of the business of the Company, except that the Committee will not take any action to amend the Restated Certificate of Incorporation or the Bylaws, to amend its Charter, to elect Directors to fill vacancies on the Board, to fix the compensation of Directors for service in any capacity, to fill vacancies on the Committee or change its membership, to elect or remove officers of the Company or to declare dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees Charter shall be posted on the Companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition: The Committee will be comprised of not less than three directors, a majority of which shall be non- management and one of which shall be the Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board shall serve as the Chairman of the Committee unless the Board elects a different director to serve as Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the absence of the Chairman of the Committee, the Lead Director of the Board will serve as Chairman of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings: The Committee will meet from time to time during the year, as needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interaction with Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluation of the CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee with input from the Board will annually review and approve corporate goals and objectives relevant to the CEOs compensation, evaluate the CEOs performance in light of such goals and objectives, and determine the CEOs compensation level based on this evaluation and other relevant information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall also review annually and determine the individual elements of total compensation of the CEO, including annual salary, annual bonus and long-term incentive compensation and report such determination to the Board, provided, however, that the annual salary, annual bonus and long-term incentive compensation shall be subject to the approval of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Compensation Committee share the responsibility for succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall maintain and review with the Board a list for the Board of potential successors to the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman shall review management succession planning with the Compensation Committee on an annual basis, and provide a report to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at Board and Committee Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman will routinely invite senior management to attend Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board or any Committee may request the presence of any Company employee at any Board or Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Chairman will invite such other managers and outside experts to the Board meetings in situations where such persons can aid the Board in its deliberations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Access to Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors will have complete access to management and management will be available to the Board with respect to any questions regarding Company issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interpretation of Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Guidelines provide a framework for governance of the Company and the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recognizes that situations may dictate variations from the Guidelines in order to respond to business changes and the needs of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Guidelines shall be revised and updated from time-to-time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Guidelines do not constitute invariable rules nor shall they preclude the Board from acting in variance thereto at any time in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board endorses and supports the Companys Core Values and Keys for Success:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe integrity is the foundation of our individual and corporate actions that drives an organization of which we are proud.

sentences.text: We are accountable for our actions, successes and failures.

sentences.text: We value the diversity of our workforce.

sentences.text: Courage:

sentences.text: We take ownership of challenges, even those that appear insurmountable
