sentences.text: Exhibit A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BAKER HUGHES INCORPORATED GUIDELINES FOR MEMBERSHIP ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS (As Amended February 25, 2016)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Guidelines set forth the policies of the Board of Directors (Board) of Baker Hughes Incorporated (Company) regarding Board membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Guidelines shall be implemented by the Governance and Health Safety and Environmental Committee of the Board (the Committee) with such modifications as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will consider candidates based upon:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The size and existing composition of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit of continuity on the Board  The relevance of the candidates background and experience to current and foreseeable business of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Criteria for Selection
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In filling director vacancies on the Board, the Committee will strive to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A) Recommend candidates for director positions who will help create a collective membership on the Board with varied experience and perspective and who:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: i) Have demonstrated leadership, and significant experience in an area of endeavor such as technology, business, finance, law, public service, banking or academia;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ii) Comprehend the role of a public company director, particularly the fiduciary obligations owed to the Company and its stockholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iii) Have relevant expertise and experience, and are able to offer advice and guidance based upon that expertise;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iv) Have a substantive understanding of domestic considerations and geopolitics, especially those pertaining to the service sector of the oil and gas and energy related industries;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: v) Will dedicate sufficient time to Company business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vi) Exhibit integrity, sound business judgment and support for the Core Values of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vii) Understand financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: viii) Are independent as defined by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the New York Stock Exchange;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ix) Support the ideals of the Companys Business Code of Conduct and are not engaged in any activity adverse to, or do not serve on the board of another company whose interests are adverse to, or in conflict with the Companys interests;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: x) Possess the ability to oversee, as a director, the affairs of the Company for the benefit of its stockholders while keeping in perspective the interests of the Companys customers, employees and the public; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xi) Are able to exercise sound business judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: B) Maintain a Board that reflects diversity, including but not limited to gender, ethnicity, background, country of citizenship and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Age & Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will not nominate any person to serve as a director who has attained the age of 75.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director shall stand for re-election in any fiscal year in which a director fails to attend at least 66% of the meetings of the Board and any Committees of the Board on which the director serves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These provisions may be waived by the Board (excluding the affected director) if the Board determines that such waiver would be in the best interest of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit/Ethics Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that it is desirable that one or more members of the Companys Audit/Ethics Committee possess those qualities and skills such that they qualify as an Audit Committee Financial Expert, as defined by SEC rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant Change in Occupation or Employment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-management director who has a significant change in occupation or retires from his or her principal employment or position will promptly notify the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will consider such change in determining if it is in the best interests of the Company to nominate such person to stand for reelection as a director at the Companys next Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Review and Assessments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year the members of the Board will participate in a review and assessment of the Board and of each committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with such reviews, or at any other time, a director with concerns regarding the performance, attendance, potential conflicts of interest, or any other concern respecting any other director shall report such concerns to the Chairman of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Committee, in consultation with such other directors as he or she deems appropriate will determine how such concerns should be investigated and reported to members of the Committee who are not the director in question (Independent Non-Management Committee Members).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Independent Non-Management Committee Members conclude that the director is not fulfilling his or her duties, they will determine what actions should be taken.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such actions may include, without limitation, the Chairman of the Board, the lead director or another Board member discussing the situation with the director in question, identifying what steps are required to improve performance, or, if appropriate, requesting that the director resign from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exhibit B
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BAKER HUGHES INCORPORATED Selection Process for New Board of Directors Candidates (As Amended January 23, 2014)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Baker Hughes Incorporated (Company) has established the following process for the selection of new candidates for the Companys Board of Directors (Board).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board or the Companys Governance and Health, Safety and Environmental Committee (the Committee) will evaluate candidates properly proposed by stockholders in the same manner as all other candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Chairman, CEO, the Committee, or other Board members identify a need to fill vacancies or add newly created directorships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Chairman of the Committee initiates search, working with staff support and seeking input from the Board members and senior management, and hiring a search firm or obtaining advice from legal or other advisors, if necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Candidates, including any candidates properly proposed by stockholders in accordance with the Companys Bylaws, that satisfy criteria as described in the Companys Guidelines for Membership on the Board of Directors or otherwise qualify for membership on the Board, are identified and presented to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Determine if the Committee members, Board members or senior management have a basis to initiate contact with preferred candidates; or if appropriate, utilize a search firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Chairman, CEO and at least one member of the Committee interviews prospective candidate(s).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. Full Board to be kept informed of progress.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. The Committee meets to consider and approve final candidate(s) (conduct interviews as necessary).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8. The Committee will propose to the full Board candidates for Board membership to fill vacancies, or to stand for election at the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exhibit C
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BAKER HUGHES INCORPORATED POLICY FOR DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE, AUDIT/ETHICS COMMITTEE MEMBERS AND AUDIT COMMITTEE FINANCIAL EXPERT (As Amended January 23, 2014)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I.    Introduction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A member of the Board of Directors (Board) of Baker Hughes Incorporated (Company) shall be deemed independent pursuant to this Policy of the Board, only if the Board affirmatively determines that (1) such director meets the standards set forth in Section II below, and (2) the director has no material relationship with the Company (either directly or as a partner, shareholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the Company).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its determination, the Board shall broadly consider all relevant facts and circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material relationships can include commercial, industrial, banking, consulting, legal, accounting, charitable and familial relationships, among others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director of the Companys Audit/Ethics Committee, Governance and Health, Safety and Environmental Committee (the Governance and HS&E Committee) and Compensation Committee must be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director who is a member of the Companys Audit/Ethics Committee is also required to meet the criteria set forth below in Section III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These standards shall be implemented by the Governance and HS&E Committee with such modifications as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: II.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Standards for Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. A director who is an employee, or whose immediate family member is an executive officer, of the Company is not independent until three years after the end of such employment relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment as an interim Chairman or CEO shall not disqualify a director from being considered independent following that employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. A director who receives, or whose immediate family member receives, more than $120,000 per year in direct compensation from the Company, other than director and committee fees and pension or other forms of deferred compensation for prior service (provided such compensation is not contingent in any way on continued service), is not independent until three years after he or she ceases to receive more than $120,000 per year in such compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation received by a director for former service as an interim Chairman or CEO need not be considered in determining independence under this test.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation received by an immediate family member for service as a non-executive employee of the Company need not be considered in determining independence under this test.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. A director who is affiliated with or employed by a present or former internal or external auditor of the Company is not independent until three years after the end of the affiliation or the employment or auditing relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director, however, is still considered independent if the directors immediate family member currently works for the companys auditor, as long as the immediate family member is not a partner of the companys auditor or is not personally involved (and has not been personally involved for the past three years) in the companys audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. A director who is employed, or whose immediate family member is employed, as an executive officer of another company where any of the Companys present executives serve on that companys compensation committee is not independent until three years after the end of such service or the employment relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. A director who is an executive officer or an employee, or whose immediate family member is an executive officer, of a company that makes payments to, or receives payments from, the Company for property or services in an amount which, in any single fiscal year, exceeds the greater of $1 million, or 2% of the consolidated gross revenues of such other company employing such executive officer or employee, is not independent until three years after falling below such threshold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In applying this test, both the payments and the consolidated gross revenues to be measured shall be those reported in the last completed fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The look-back provision for this test applies solely to the financial relationship between the Company and the director or immediate family members current employer; the Company need not consider former employment of the director or immediate family member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Charitable organizations shall not be considered companies for purposes of this test, provided however that the Company shall disclose in its annual proxy statement any charitable contributions made by the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company to any charitable organization in which a director serves as an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executive officer if, within the preceding three years, contributions in any single fiscal year exceeded the greater of $1 million, or 2% of such charitable organizations consolidated gross revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Standards for Audit/Ethics Committee Members
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. A director who is a member of the Audit/Ethics Committee other than in his or her capacity as a member of the Audit/Ethics Committee, the Board, or any other Board committee, may not accept directly or indirectly any consulting, advisory, or other compensatory fee from the Company or any subsidiary thereof, provided that, unless the rules of the NYSE provide otherwise, compensatory fees do not include the receipt of fixed amounts of compensation under a retirement plan (including deferred compensation) for prior service with the Company (provided that such compensation is not contingent in any way on continued service).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indirect acceptance of compensatory payments includes: (1) payments to spouses, minor children or stepchildren, or children or stepchildren sharing a household with the member; or (2) payments accepted by an entity in which such member is a partner, member, officer such as a managing director occupying a comparable position or executive officer, or occupies a similar position and which provides accounting, consulting, legal, investment banking or financial advisory services to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. A director, who is a member of the Audit/Ethics Committee may not, other than in his or her capacity as a member of the Audit/Ethics Committee, the Board, or any other Board committee, be an affiliated person of the Company or any subsidiary thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. A member of the Audit/Ethics Committee may not simultaneously serve on the audit committees of more than two other public companies in addition to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IV.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Definitions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An immediate family member includes a persons spouse, parents, children, siblings, mothers and fathers-in-law, sons and daughters-in-law, brothers and sisters-in-law, and anyone (other than domestic employees) who shares such persons household.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When considering the application of the three-year period referred to in each of paragraphs II.1 through II.5 above, the Company need not consider individuals who are no longer immediate family members as a result of legal separation or divorce, or those who have died or become incapacitated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company includes any subsidiary in a consolidated group with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT/ETHICS COMMITTEE FINANCIAL EXPERT QUALIFICATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that it is desirable that one or more members of the Audit/Ethics Committee possess such qualities and skills such that they qualify as an Audit Committee Financial Expert as defined by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC rules define an Audit Committee Financial Expert as a director who has the following attribute
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) The ability to assess the general application of such principles in connection with the accounting for estimates, accruals and reserves;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: experience actively supervising one or more persons engaged in such activities; (d) An understanding of internal controls and procedures for financial reporting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under SEC rules, a director must have acquired such attributes through any one or more of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: functions; (b) Experience actively supervising a principal financial officer, principal accounting officer, controller, public accountant, auditor or person performing similar functions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Experience overseeing or assessing the performance of companies or public accountants with respect to the preparation, auditing or evaluation of financial statements; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Other relevant experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exhibit D
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BAKER HUGHES INCORPORATED POLICY AND SUBMISSION PROCEDURES FOR STOCKHOLDER RECOMMENDED DIRECTOR CANDIDATES (As Amended July 28, 2016)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and Health, Safety and Environmental Committee (the Committee) of Baker Hughes Incorporated (Company) has established a policy that it will consider director candidates recommended by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Board of Directors (Board) or the Committee will evaluate candidates properly proposed by stockholders in the same manner as all other candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such recommendations should be communicated to the Chairman, Governance and Health, Safety and Environmental Committee of the Board of Directors, P.O. Box 4740, Houston, Texas 77210-4740 or to the Corporate Secretary, c/o Baker Hughes Incorporated, 17021 Aldine Westfield Road, Houston, Texas 77073 and should be accompanied by the types of information as are required under the Companys Bylaws for stockholder nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In summary, the Companys Bylaws provide in substance that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Stockholder nominations shall be made pursuant to timely written notice (a Nomination Notice).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be timely, a Nomination Notice must be received by the Secretary not less than 120 days, nor more than 150 days, before the one-year anniversary of the date on which the Companys proxy statement was released to stockholders in connection with the previous year's annual meeting of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. The Nomination Notice shall set forth
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) all information relating to the nominee as required to be disclosed in solicitations of proxies for election of directors, or as otherwise required, in each case pursuant to Regulation 14A under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 or any successor regulation thereto (including such person's written consent to be named in the proxy statement as a nominee and to serve as a director if elected),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the nominees independence, any voting commitments and/or other obligations such person will be bound by as a director, and any material relationships between such person and (1) the nominating stockholder, or (2) the beneficial owner, if any, on whose behalf the nomination is made (each nominating party and each beneficial owner, a nominating party), including compensation and financial transactions,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the nominating partys name and record address,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the class, series, and number of shares of the Company that are owned beneficially and of record, directly or indirectly, by each nominating party,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) all other related ownership interests directly or indirectly owned beneficially by each nominating party, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) any interest of each nominating party in such nomination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the request of the Board, any person nominated by the Board for election as a director shall furnish to the Corporate Secretary of the Company that information required to be set forth in a stockholder's Nomination Notice that pertains to the nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing is a generalized summary and the specific requirements of the Bylaws shall control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exhibit E
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BAKER HUGHES INCORPORATED STOCKHOLDER COMMUNICATIONS WITH THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS (As Amended July 28, 2016)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to provide the stockholders and other interested parties of Baker Hughes Incorporated (Company) with a direct and open line of communication to the Companys Board of Directors (Board), the following procedures have been established for communications to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested persons may communicate with any member of the Board, including the Companys Lead Director, the Chairman of any of the Companys Governance and Health, Safety and Environmental Committee, Audit/Ethics Committee, Compensation Committee, Finance Committee or with the independent non-management directors of the Company as a group, by sending such written communication to the following address:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Secretary c/o Baker Hughes Incorporated 17021 Aldine Westfield Road Houston, TX 77073
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders desiring to make candidate recommendations for the Board may do so by submitting nominations to the Companys Governance and Health, Safety and Environmental Committee, in accordance with the Companys Bylaws and Policy and Submission Procedures for Stockholder Recommended Director Candidates addressed, as above, to the Corporate Secretary, or to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman, Governance and HS&E Committee of the Board of Directors P.O. Box 4740 Houston, TX 77210-4740
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any written communications received by the Corporate Secretary will be forwarded to the appropriate directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exhibit F
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BAKER HUGHES INCORPORATED PROCEDURES FOR THE RECEIPT, RETENTION AND TREATMENT OF COMPLAINTS (As Amended October 22, 2009)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sarbanes-Oxley Act Section 301 Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (SOX) Section 301 requires that each audit committee establish procedures for the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints received by the Company regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters; and confidential, anonymous submissions by employees of the Company of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guidelines for Reporting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Complaints or concerns regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters may be submitted by employees and/or third parties to the Business Help Line or the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Concerns received by the Business Help Line, which accepts anonymous submissions, are forwarded to the CCO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All complaints received by the CCO are reviewed and validated and a list of all such items will be provided to the Chairman of the Audit/Ethics Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CCO has an affirmative duty to report all issues for which the CCO has credible evidence of a material or potential violation of any applicable securities laws, fiduciary duty, or similar violation to the Audit/Ethics Committee (AEC) in a timely manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CCO may bring any issue to the attention of the AEC if, in the CCOs opinion, it is necessary and appropriate to inform the AEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the CCO brings an issue to the AEC, the AEC and the CCO will collaboratively discuss the issue and agree to a course of action which may include an internal investigation involving one or more of the CCO, Corporate Security, Human Resources department, Operations, Internal Audit and outside counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CCO will maintain appropriate records for all issues presented to the AEC and provide updates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CCO will retain issue related documentation in accordance with the Companys record retention policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that a complaint is received concerning the CCO, the complaint will be sent directly to the Chairman of the AEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the AEC will decide the appropriate course of action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Third party reporting procedures are posted on the Companys Internet website in the Investor Relations-Compliance Section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reporting protocol for employees is posted on the intranet within the Interchange-Legal Compliance site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the websites, the Company has a Business Help Line brochure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No employee shall suffer retaliation in any form for reporting, in good faith, suspected violations of the Business Code of Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNEX B
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BAKER HUGHES INCORPORATED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CHARTER OF THE AUDIT/ETHICS COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS (as amended and restated January 25, 2017)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of Baker Hughes Incorporated (the Company) has heretofore constituted and established an Audit/Ethics Committee (the Committee) with authority, responsibility and specific duties as described in this Charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is intended that this Charter and the composition of the Committee comply with the rules of the New York Stock Exchange (the NYSE).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This document replaces and supersedes in its entirety the previous Charter of the Committee adopted by the Board of Directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PURPOSE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee's purpose is to assist the Board of Directors with oversight of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the integrity of the Company's financial statements and financial reporting system,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Company's compliance with legal and regulatory requirements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the ndependent auditor's qualifications, independence and performance and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the performance of the Company's internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall also prepare the report of the Committee to be included in the Company's annual proxy statement, carry out the duties and responsibilities set forth in this Charter and conduct an annual self-evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPOSITION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and Chairman of the Committee shall be elected annually by the Board of Directors and are subject to removal pursuant to the terms of the Company's Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall be comprised of not less than three non- employee Directors who are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) independent (as defined by Section 10A(m)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the rules and regulations thereunder and the NYSE) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) financially literate (as interpreted by the Board of Directors in its business judgment).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such Committee members may not simultaneously serve on the audit committee of more than three public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least one member of the Committee shall be an audit committee financial expert, as defined by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The audit committee financial expert must have:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an understanding of GAAP and financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) experience in the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) preparation, auditing, analyzing or evaluating of financial statements of generally comparable issuers or supervising one or more persons engaged in such activities and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) applying GAAP principles in connection with the accounting for estimates, accruals and reserves;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) an understanding of internal control over financial reporting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) an understanding of audit committee functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may, if appropriate, delegate its authority to subcommittees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a member of the Committee ceases to be independent for reasons outside the member's reasonable control, his or her membership on the committee may, if so permitted under then applicable NYSE rules, continue until the earlier of the Company's next annual meeting of stockholders or one year from the occurrence of the event that caused the failure to qualify as independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The principal responsibilities of the Committee are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to provide assistance to the Board of Directors in fulfilling its responsibility in matters relating to the accounting and reporting practices of the Company, the adequacy of the Company's internal controls over financial reporting and disclosure controls and procedures, and the quality and integrity of the financial statements of the Company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) to oversee the Company's compliance programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent auditor is ultimately accountable to the Board of Directors and the Committee, as representatives of the Company's stockholders, and shall report directly to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the ultimate authority and direct responsibility to select, appoint, evaluate, compensate and oversee the work, and, if necessary, terminate and replace the independent auditor (subject, if applicable, to stockholder ratification).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have authority to conduct or authorize investigations into any matters within its scope of responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have the authority to engage independent counsel and other advisors, as the Committee deems necessary to carry out its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have the sole authority to approve the fees paid to any independent advisor retained by the Committee, and the Company shall provide funding for such payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company must provide funding for ordinary administrative expenses of the Committee that are necessary or appropriate in carrying out its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall review the composition, expertise and availability of the Committee members on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall also perform a self-evaluation of the Committee and its activities on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall meet in executive session at each regularly scheduled meeting, including separate, private meetings with the independent registered public accounting firm, corporate auditors, general counsel and compliance officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall also meet in executive session with such other employees as it deems necessary and appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Charter is intended to be flexible so that the Committee is able to meet changing conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is authorized to take such further actions as are consistent with the following described responsibilities and to perform such other actions as applicable law, the NYSE, the Company's charter documents and/or the Board of Directors may require.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, the Committee shall review and reassess the adequacy of this Charter annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any proposed changes shall be put before the Board of Directors for its approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to its audit responsibilities, the Committee shall:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receive and review reports from the independent registered public accounting firm pursuant to the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (SOX) and Section 10(A)(k) of the Exchange Act regarding:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) all critical accounting policies and practices being used;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) all alternative treatments of financial information within generally accepted accounting principles that have been discussed with management, and the treatment preferred by the independent registered public accounting firm; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) other material written communications between the independent auditor and management, such as any management letter or schedule of unrecorded audit adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, receive and review formal written reports from the independent registered public accounting firm regarding the auditors' independence required by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) Ethics and Independence Rule 3526 Communication with Audit Committees Concerning Independence, giving consideration to the range of audit and non-audit services performed by them and all their relationships with the Company, as well as a report describing the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) independent registered public accounting firm's internal quality-control procedures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any material issues raised by the most recent internal quality-control review or peer review, of the independent registered public accounting firm, or by any inquiry or investigation by governmental or professional authorities; within the preceding five years with respect to one or more independent audits carried out by the auditors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any steps taken to deal with such issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conduct an active discussion with the independent registered public accounting firm with respect to any disclosed relationships or services that may impact the objectivity and independence of the auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Select the independent registered public accounting firm to be employed or discharged by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and evaluate competence of partners and managers of the independent registered public accounting firm who lead the audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by law, ensure the rotation of the lead audit partner having primary responsibility for the Company's audit and the audit partner responsible for reviewing the audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider whether there should be a rotation of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall establish hiring policies for the Company of employees or former employees of the independent registered public accounting firm in accordance with the NYSE rules, SOX and as specified by the SEC and review and discuss with management and the independent registered public accounting firm any proposals for hiring any key member of the independent registered public accounting firm's team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to commencement of the annual audit, review with management, the corporate auditors and the independent registered public accounting firm the proposed scope of the audit plan and fees, including the areas of business to be examined, the personnel to be assigned to the audit, the procedures to be followed, special areas to be investigated, as well as the program for integration of the independent and internal audit efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review policies and procedures for the engagement of the independent registered public accounting firm to provide audit and non-audit services, giving due consideration to whether the independent auditor's performance of non-
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: audit services is compatible with the auditor's independence and review and pre-approve all audit and non-audit fees for such services, subject to the de minimus exception under SOX.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the exception of the annual audit, the Committee may delegate to a member of the Committee the authority to pre-approve all audit and non-audit services with any such decision presented to the full Committee at the next scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review with management and the independent registered public accounting firm the accounting and reporting policies and procedures that may be viewed as critical accounting estimates, any improvements, questions of choice and material changes in accounting policies and procedures, including interim accounting, as well as significant accounting, auditing and SEC pronouncements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review with management and the independent registered public accounting firm any financial reporting and disclosure issues, including material correcting adjustments and off-balance sheet financings and relationships, if any.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discuss significant judgment matters made in connection with the preparation of the Company's financial statements and ascertain that any significant disagreements among them have been satisfactorily resolved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ascertain that no restrictions were placed by management on implementation of the independent or corporate auditors' examinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regularly scheduled executive sessions will be held for this purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review with management, the corporate auditors and the independent registered public accounting firm the results of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the annual audit prior to release of the audited financial statements in the Company's annual report on Form 10-K filed with the SEC, including a review of the MD&A section; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the quarterly financial statements prior to release in the Company's quarterly report on Form 10-Q filed with the SEC, including a review of the MD&A section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Have management review the Company's financial results with the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and discuss with management and the independent registered public accounting firm management's report on internal control prior to the filing of the Company's annual report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establish guidelines with respect to earnings releases and financial information and earnings guidance provided to analysts and rating agencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may request a prior review of any annual or quarterly earnings release or earnings guidance and delegate to the Chairman of the Committee the authority to review any such earnings releases and guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review with the Board of Directors any issues that arise with respect to the quality or integrity of the Company's financial statements and financial reporting system, the Company's compliance with legal or regulatory requirements, the performance and independence of the Company's independent registered public accounting firm or the performance of the internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review guidelines and policies on enterprise risk management including risk assessment and risk management related to the Company's major financial and related information technology risk exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control such exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually prepare an audit committee report for inclusion in the Company's proxy statement stating that the Committee has
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements with management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm the matters required to be discussed by Auditing Standard No. 1301, "Communications with Audit Committees";
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) received a formal written report from the independent registered public accounting firm concerning the auditors' independence required by the PCAOB's Ethics and Independence Rule 3526, Communication with Audit Committees Concerning Independence and has discussed with the independent accountant the independent accountant's independence; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) based upon the review and discussion of the audited financial statements with both management and the independent registered public accounting firm, the Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial statements be included in the Company's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the last fiscal year for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cause the Charter to be included periodically in the proxy statement as required by applicable rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review actions taken by management on the independent registered public accounting firm and corporate auditors' recommendations relating to organization, internal controls and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meet separately and periodically with management, the corporate auditors and the independent registered public accounting firm to review the responsibilities, budget and staffing of the Company's internal audit function, the effectiveness of the Company's internal controls, including computerized information systems controls, and security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review the Company's annual internal audit plan, staffing and budget, and receive regular reports on their activities, including significant findings and management's actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review annually the audit of the travel and entertainment expenses of the Company's senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review annually the audit of the travel expenses of the members of the Company's Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least every three years the Committee reviews the Corporate Audit Department Charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least every five years the Committee reviews the report received from a qualified, independent audit firm regarding its quality assurance review of the Company's internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review membership of the Company's Disclosure Control and Internal Control Committee (DCIC), the DCIC's scheduled activities and the DCIC's quarterly report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review on an annual basis the DCIC Charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receive reports from the CEO and CFO on any material weaknesses and significant deficiencies in the design or operation of certain internal controls over financial reporting and any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the Company's internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review reports, media coverage and similar public information provided to analysts and rating agencies, as the Committee deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establish formal procedures for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints received by the Company regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the confidential, anonymous submissions by Company employees of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing matters, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the protection of reporting employees from retaliation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually review with the independent registered public accounting firm any audit problems or difficulties and management's response.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee must regularly review with the independent auditor any difficulties the auditor encountered in the course of the audit work, including any restrictions on the scope of the independent registered public accounting firm' activities or on access to requested information, and any significant disagreements with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the items the Committee may want to review with the auditors are: any accounting adjustments that were noted or proposed by the auditor but were passed (as immaterial or otherwise); any communications between the audit team and the audit firm's national office respecting auditing or accounting issues presented by the engagement; and any management or internal control letter issued, or proposed to be issued, by the audit firm to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to its compliance responsibilities, the Committee shall:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review policies and procedures that the Company has implemented regarding compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, including the Company's Business Code of Conduct and its Foreign Corrupt Practices Act policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitor the effectiveness of these policies and procedures for compliance with the U.S. Federal Sentencing Guidelines, as amended, and institute any changes or revisions to such policies and procedures may be deemed, warranted or necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review in conjunction with counsel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any legal matters that could have significant impact on the organization's financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) correspondence and material inquiries received from regulators or governmental agencies; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) all matters relating to the ethics of the Company and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Coordinate the Company's compliance with inquiries from any government officials concerning legal compliance in the areas covered by the Business Code of Conduct and the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Respond to such other duties as may be assigned to the Committee, from time to time, by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Committee has the responsibilities and powers set forth in this Charter, it is not the duty of the Committee to plan or conduct audits; those are the responsibilities of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, it is not the Committee's responsibility to determine that the Company's financial statements are complete and accurate and are in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles; those are the responsibilities of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nor is it the duty of the Committee to conduct investigations, to resolve disagreements, if any, between management and the independent auditor or to assure compliance with laws and regulations or with Company policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MEETINGS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will meet at least five times per year as determined by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special meetings may be called, as needed, by the Chairman of the Board of Directors or the Chairman of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may create subcommittees who shall report to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may ask employees, the independent registered public accounting firm, corporate auditors or others whose advice and counsel the Committee deems relevant to attend meetings and provide information to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will be available to the independent registered public accounting firm and the corporate auditors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All meetings of the Committee will be held pursuant to the Bylaws of the Company and written minutes of each meeting will be duly filed in the Company records.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reports of meetings of the Committee shall be made to the Board of Directors at its next regularly scheduled meeting following the Committee meeting accompanied by any recommendations to the Board of Directors approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
